story:
Who Are You?

My name is R. R. Washburn. I have aspired to be writer ever since my first grade teacher gave me a pencil and paper and told us kids to write stuff.

Since then, I have written over ten (unpublished) novels ranging from urban fantasy to science fiction to horror. Only in 2007, after the death of my mother, I suffered several years of severe depression that crippled my ability to write.

It wasn't until one day while wading through the tedium of the cubicle barnyard lifestyle that was my full-time job did I start rewriting an old draft of mine from high school, Seraphim Ascent. Before long, I had rekindled my love of writing and my desire to publish once again.

Finishing the first book I had written after my mother's death was a huge eye-opener for me, reminding me why I write, and that this was something I have always wanted to do since I was a little girl.

What Do You Need The Money For?

My goal now is to publish the second installment, Seraphim Storm, as well as a short prequel novel, What the Thunder Said, sometime by early 2015. I aim to be prolific.

All contributions will be utilized entirely to support my series. It will help fund my cover artist, as well as any beta readers/editors that I need to hire in order to publish a quality manuscript. When you break it down, you will not only supporting me as the writer, but you'll also be supporting an artist as well any editors that I hire.

Remaining funds will go towards me following my dream, including:

  • promotional efforts such as blog tours and public appearances
  • ordering paperbacks
  • swag for the perks
  • publishing future titles from novels, novellas, and short stories

What Happens If You Don't Reach Your Goal?

Worry not! You will still receive your perks and walk away with fuzzy feelings and the knowledge that you have played a part in supporting my dream. If I don't hit my goal, the money will go to paying off my cover artist, as well as the editing of Seraphim Storm.

Other Ways You Can Help...

  • Every little bit helps, actually! Even if it's just a few dollars. :)
  • Get the word out! Share it with your friends and family. Blog it. Tweet it. Post about it to Facebook. If you know anyone who has any love for science fiction, dystopia, apocalyptic and horror stories with with strong leading ladies and don't mind LGBT representation, then make noise! Like I said, every little bit helps.
  • Share, share, share the love!

So What's This Series You Wrote About?

On September 2014, I published my first novel, Seraphim Ascent. It explores the story of a woman named Rey, who awakens in the morgue of an abandoned asylum with only a toe tag to her name and no memory as to how she got there. She finds herself in a mid-Twenty-Second Century dystopian society, where the United States as we know it has been divided into two governments from the east and west. As the story progresses and more about Rey's identity is revealed, her past will beg to question if the truth is a skeleton she wants digging out of the closet.

Seraphim Ascent was a huge milestone for me. Not only did it inspire me to reconnect with a piece of myself I thought I had lost, it's also taken me down a journey of self-discovery as well. PROJECT SERAPHIM as a whole explores identity with characters who have endured their own share of loss and suffering, and eventually becomes something more.

In Seraphim Storm, I take the story a step further by exploring relationships between characters, ranging from romantic, to friendship, to family. I wanted to write a story focusing on main characters who happen to be LGBT+ and strong women fighting against a perilous threat.

You can read more about Seraphim Storm on my website.

What Else Is There?

Maybe I've missed something that's itching on the back of your mind that you're just dying to know. Hit me up by way of campaign comments, or check me out on my official website or Facebook page. A little curiosity won't kill you. :)

story:
Welcome to Plenitude Magazine's Inaugural Fundraiser! 

Because we are a literary magazine, we love interviews and imagining made-up conversations, and so here is the interview we are so happy to have just done with YOU about all of the questions we imagined you might have. That's right—we don't have a fancy video. We're all about the power of the good, old fashioned word and made-up conversations. 

Who are you, anyway, and why are you doing this fundraiser?

Plenitude is Canada’s only self-described queer literary magazine. Founding editor turned piano tuner Andrea Routley started the magazine in 2012 while a student at the University of Victoria. In the past four years, Plenitude has become a hub of queer literature in Canada. In addition to publishing poetry, fiction, and book and film reviews, Plenitude offers an emerging writer mentorship program to pair emerging writers with more established queer writers, runs queer press profiles to support and give visibility to independent queer presses throughout Canada, and hosts an events calendar of queer Canadian literary events and calls for submissions.

At Plenitude, we recognize that readers are hungry for exceptional works that reflect queer histories, cultures, and experiences. 

As a queer, independent magazine, we are committed to publishing marginalized voices and covering topics that are often ignored by the mainstream. We do this with a small, incredibly dedicated team of editors, writers, and volunteers and a grant from Canada Council of the Arts. 

We are so grateful for our Canada Council funding, but as you can imagine, having only one source of funding limits the ways in which we can be there for you—our wonderful community of readers and writers! This is why we need your support! 

This sounds exciting and important! But can you break it down for me? What is it, EXACTLY, that you want to do?

Sure thing! It's pretty simple. Raising $1000 will allow us to: 

  • Pay our writers more! With $1000, we'll be able to increase the honorariums we pay our writers from $40 to $55 for prose and reviews and $25 for poems. Basically, we want to make sure that we're paying our writers as much as we possibly can while remaining within our very limited budget. Art isn't free and it certainly isn't cheap! Often, marginalized writers simply can't afford to write for free, and we want to make sure that we have a diversity of voices in our magazine. If you read and love Plenitude, know that your donation will go towards compensating the writers who create the work you love! We are so excited to be able to pay our writers more! They deserve it! 
  • Financially support writers and staff in attending various literary events. Your donation will go towards having Plenitude represented at festivals such as Word on the Street, Naked Heart, Queer Between the Covers, and FOLD. 

What happens if you don't make your goal?

Any money we make will go towards increasing the amount of money we pay our writers and paying for writers and staff to attend literary festivals on behalf of Plenitude. Of course, the number of festivals we'll be able to pay to attend and the amount by which we'll be able to raise our pay rates will be dependent on how close we are to reaching our goal. In other words, every dollar counts, but the more dollars, the better!

How can I help out? 

Aside from donating, we'd love it if you could spread the word! Share our campaign on social media, tell your friends, tell your lovers, tell your enemies (one person's enemy is another person's donor!), tell your neighbours (what better way to get to know them?), tell your family! But seriously, please tell everyone you know about our little fundraiser that CAN and WILL! 

What kind of effect is Plenitude already having on its community? What are people saying about the magazine?

"Plenitude is a collection of words that scream, 'you are not alone,' even in times where you can’t even process how that is true, or why it would be  important. We’re queer when we wake up, when we go to sleep, when we throw rocks through windows, when we get jealous, when we use the Internet for lovers and when we lose ours. Plenitude is like a living testament to that fact.” —Carmen Rios, Autostraddle 

"I love that Plenitude exists, period.  It’s such a cool queer literary magazine; it gladdens my heart!”  —Arleen Paré, Plenitude contributor and Governor General's Award–winning author of four published books 
"In the dark of the night, when I'm in my bed and lonely again, and the world feels too big to bear, it's the Plenitudes of the world that give comfort. I'm not shitting you. Queer writing is company. Queer writing is a warm light into an open doorway. I'm so grateful for Plenitude, and its vision. It gives me, and my friends, and all those I-wish-these-amazing people-were-my-friends, and the one-day-we'll-meet-and-be-friends-dammit a place to co-mingle. Queer writing is always and ever sophisticating. People-raising. Adult-making. Ideas-growing. Love-spreading. Plenitude is my buddy, through and through." —Michael V. Smith, award-winning author, comedian, and clown. Michael is also our 2016 mentor for the Emerging Writer Mentorship Award. 
"Canada needs a venue where we don’t have to write our way past these queer narratives that have dominated mainstream representations. I don’t want to clarify the sexual history of every character because this theoretical ‘average reader’ is unfamiliar with queer histories and cultures, for example. If I did that, then every story would be like a new conversation with a stranger. If we’re always introducing ourselves, how can we really dig in?" —Andrea Routley on why she started the magazine

story:
Who We Are

The Breaking Ground is a writing and performance community in North Eastern, Pennsylvania where local youth ages 14-19 are given an opportunity to speak their truth and develop critical thinking and writing skills. It is a space where teenagers can share their hopes, their fears, and their ugliest most honest truths without the judgment that surrounds us on a daily basis.

As a community organization we support each other to grow into our best possible selves. This is accomplished through monthly open mics and writing workshops,

  • The group is directed by Katie Wisnosky, an English teacher from Tunkhannock Area High School.
  • Co-Coach Jim Warner is an adjunct instructor at Benedictine University and managing editor at Quiddity International Literary Journal and Public-Radio Program. He is also a contributing writer at Sundog Lit.
  • Co-Coach Sarah Zane-Lewis has been performing poetry for 20 years and has featured at the Seattle Poetry Slam, the National Poetry Slam, as well as a lot of other festivals and shows. Previously, she served on the Board of Directors for the National Poetry Slam. As part of the Emerging Voice program, she has taught poetry and performance in high schools, community centers and juvenile detention centers.

All mentors involved in our program also go without pay. They volunteer their time because they know writing and honest conversations save lives.

HELP BGP REPRESENT AT BRAVE NEW VOICES!

Six talented young writers and performers will represent Tunkhannock at the historic Brave New Voices International Slam Festival in Philadelphia, where teenage poets from over 50 cities gather to compete and build community as writers. It is four days of transformative dialogue and art, and no person leaves the festival unchanged. 

This year, we ask your support not only to send our slam team to represent Tunkhannock, but also so that a select few leaders who hold down the operations of BGP can experience Brave New Voices and infuse our yearly programming with the energy, insight and practices gained from building with poets from all over the country and the globe.

OUR ASK

In order to send our slam team, four select youth leaders, entourage, and supervising mentors from our program to participate fully in the slams, workshops, dialogues and performance opportunities of Brave New Voices, we need to raise $3,500. This money goes towards travel expenses to Philadelphia, dormitory housing and board through the festival, 2 meals a day, and all access granted to workshops, town halls, and competitions.

The Impact

This year's local slams featured amazing performances. These kids were the top six chosen to represent BGP:

• Keri Klinges

• Angelo Maruzzelli

•Maggie Gilbertson

• Kiera Merritt

• Aidan Cronin

• Olivia Romano

About Breaking Ground Poets

Since 2011, BGP has been the only youth spoken word poetry organization in North Eastern Pennsylvania. Our community organization focuses on developing  youth voices through creative writing instruction and performance opportunities. Over the years, BGP has conducted workshops and performances with Andrea Gibson, Lauren Zuniga, Anis Mojgani, Buddy Wakefield, Jon Sands, Jeanann Verlee, Clementine Von Radics and countless local published poets and professors. We have featured at a variety of open mics and hosted our own monthly open mic series that has thrived for the past three years.

Our goal is to provide young people with the courage to imagine and freedom to create a healthy future for themselves while developing their critical thinking, writing, and performance skills. 

And that’s all there is to it. Without your donation, many of these kids will not be able to attend the festival. We come from a rural community where drug, poverty and family issues present major challenges to our teenagers. As a mentor in our program, I am  inspired every day by the teenagers  who make the effort to devote their time on the weekends and after school to cultivate safe spaces and seek out opportunities to raise their voices to create change in a positive manner within our community.

I encourage you to make the same effort these teens do and create positive change in our community through your support and donation.

Warmly -

Katie Wisnosky

story:
My Story

In the winter of 2007/8 I found myself homeless and living on the streets of America - oh, happy days! However, it was during this time that I was suddenly struck with a thought, which seemingly came from nowhere: a comedic story about an average man, Albert Smith, who suddenly discovers he is the most important person ever to have lived. I spent my time scribbling the tale down on any scraps of paper I could find, throwing my all into it (basically because it enabled me to forget my miserable existence).

All-in-all, I spent 5 months on the streets, but I was given help by friends during this period, which I will never forget nor can I ever repay. I continued with the 'story of Smith' when my life returned to a semblance of normality, and one year later it was published.

My mother (an avid book reader, and book seller) refused to accept that it would never see the light of day, and so she paid for the publishing of it; without her it is possible it would never have been read by anyone.

I now live in Southern Germany, and will be getting married during the month of June to my wonderful fiancée, who has been a rock in my life - not least with Smith. Although not setting the World on fire, it is selling and has gained a small but hardcore audience, who have been demanding a sequel.

I am currently working on the sequel, titled Nothing, and this is why I am here asking for your help, so that as many people as possible can discover who Albert Smith is.


The Impact

Just like with the original novel, this (eventually, but who knows when) will be published no matter what, but as with most things, money makes life easier; knowing that with your help I can definitely get it published (and far more quickly, too), but it certainly will help with the promotion of it, something I have struggled immensely with, with Smith.

Writing the original and writing the (not finished) sequel has been so rewarding - knowing I have made complete strangers laugh out loud whilst reading it, is almost satisfaction enough. But I would so love to be able to spread the word of Albert Smith to a far greater audience. I am not fooling myself that I will get a #1 New York Times best-seller, but with your help, I can publish Nothing and get more people laughing.


What I Need

Firstly, the actual publishing of the novel: this is going to cost at least $1,200. Not cheap, granted, but they did, and are doing, such a wonderful job with Smith, that it would be silly not to go back to them again.

Secondly, the marketing of Nothing. This involves sending out many copies of the novel (once published) to the worldwide media (which would require me to buy them myself, hence the request), and promotional marketing (such as postcards, bookmarks, and mini rolling pins - which you will understand if you have read my first novel). Additionally, it would be great to be able to offer book-stores a bulk lot of the sequel, on a no-sale, no-fee basis. The more that is pledged, the more I can promote, so should I be fortunate enough to exceed my goal, that is where the extra money will go.

Thirdly, my life would be so much easier with a new (but basic) English lap-top. The one I am using now, although works, is very old and German, and I am unable to change the OS language on it (and the wi-fi doesn't work anymore either, meaning I am tied down). This isn't anywhere near as important as either of the first two requests request, so should I not reach my goal, I would continue to make do with what I have. I used to have an English one, but it died a horrible death, which was not pretty to watch.

I have no other method of funding, because very few people even know about the existence of Smith, and that has always been the main problem. But in life, you should do what you love, and I refuse to give up on Albert Smith, just like he refused to give up on me the day he walked into my life.

I am offering plenty of perks, which you can see listed on the right - can't ask for help, if I am not offering a proper thank you, can I? Even the smallest pledge will help, every single cent counts.

Additionally, I am working in Euros, hence the fairly high 'Goal'.


Other Ways You Can Help

As said already, I have promoted Smith using essentially no money, and so Albert Smith has his own Facebook page, Twitter page, and, naturally, a website, which I somehow managed to design myself (and where you will discover the book's, and my sense of humor). If nothing else, I would appreciate you visiting these places, and adding them if you are on Facebook or Twitter.

Additionally, another character from Smith, called The Toaster, is also on Facebook, who spends his time telling all that he will destroy everyone - something that people seem to be only to happy to hear for some unknown reason.

At least you now know who Albert Smith is.

Just like with the original novel, this (eventually, but who knows when) will be published no matter what, but as with most things, money makes life easier; knowing that with your help I can definitely get it published (and far more quickly, too), but it certainly will help with the promotion of it, something I have struggled immensely with, with Smith.
Writing the original and writing the (not finished) sequel has been so rewarding - knowing I have made complete strangers laugh out loud whilst reading it, is almost satisfaction enough. But I would so love to be able to spread the word of Albert Smith to a far greater audience. I am not fooling myself that I will get a #1 New York Times best-seller, but with your help, I can publish Nothing and get more people laughing.


What I Need
Firstly, the actual publishing of the novel: this is going to cost at least $1,200. Not cheap, granted, but they did, and are doing, such a wonderful job with Smith, that it would be silly not to go back to them again.
Secondly, the marketing of Nothing. This involves sending out many copies of the novel (once published) to the worldwide media (which would require me to buy them myself, hence the request), and promotional marketing (such as postcards, bookmarks, and mini rolling pins - which you will understand if you have read my first novel). Additionally, it would be great to be able to offer book-stores a bulk lot of the sequel, on a no-sale, no-fee basis. The more that is pledged, the more I can promote, so should I be fortunate enough to exceed my goal, that is where the extra money will go.
Thirdly, my life would be so much easier with a new (but basic) English lap-top. The one I am using now, although works, is very old and German, and I am unable to change the OS language on it (and the wi-fi doesn't work anymore either, meaning I am tied down). This isn't anywhere near as important as either of the first two requests request, so should I not reach my goal, I would continue to make do with what I have. I used to have an English one, but it died a horrible death, which was not pretty to watch.
I have no other method of funding, because very few people even know about the existence of Smith, and that has always been the main problem. But in life, you should do what you love, and I refuse to give up on Albert Smith, just like he refused to give up on me the day he walked into my life.
I am offering plenty of perks, which you can see listed on the right - can't ask for help, if I am not offering a proper thank you, can I? Even the smallest pledge will help, every single cent counts.
Additionally, I am working in Euros, hence the fairly high 'Goal'.

Other Ways You Can Help

As said already, I have promoted Smith using essentially no money, and so Albert Smith has his own Facebook page, Twitter page, and, naturally, a website, which I somehow managed to design myself (and where you will discover the book's, and my sense of humor). If nothing else, I would appreciate you visiting these places, and adding them if you are on Facebook or Twitter.
Additionally, another character from Smith, called The Toaster, is also on Facebook, who spends his time telling all that he will destroy everyone - something that people seem to be only to happy to hear for some unknown reason.
At least you now know who Albert Smith is.

story:
My name is Michael J. Sullivan, and I've been publishing for a little less than a decade. Over that time, I have released 14 novels and sold more than 1.4 million books in the English language (and an unknown number through my 75+ foreign language translations.

I recently heard from one of my publishers (Del Rey, a fantasy imprint of Penguin Random House), that they have put the hardcover edition of Age of Swords out of print, and they're offering me the opportunity to buy the remaining stock before the books are pulped or offered to resellers.  Unfortunately, buying those remaining copies aren't cheap. But neither are the prices that marketplace sellers are charging.

Prices for new (and used) copies of this book have already skyrocketed.

These sellers are capitalizing on the out-of-print status.  I hate this kind of price-gouging, and if I gobble up all the remaining books they won't be able to get any more copies. The above screenshot was taken 8/26/18. For current prices use this link.

Whether pulped, remaindered, or sold through resellers, I, the author, receive exactly $0 from any future sales of this edition. But that doesn't bother me nearly as much as the fact that my readers will either not be able to get a copy or will have to pay outrageous pricing because they waited too long to pick up the hardcover when it was first released.

This campaign is being launched to solve these two problems. If funded, I'll buy those remaining copies and sell them at list price ($28 on my website, but I'll offer a 20% discount for purchases through this campaign). 

But this is the 2nd book in the series, I don't want to jump into the middle!

That's a perfectly understandable sentiment, and that is why this project also provides perks to get the first book as well.  Heck, you can buy all three released novels if you want to!

Now that we are fully funded (and thanks for that, by the way), let's provide some stretch goals to take the project to the next level (and give you some bonus perks).  So here goes:

  • GOAL #4: $30,000 total funding - I'll write a second short-story based on the world of Legends of the First Empire. This one will feature Suri and Minna.
     
  • GOAL #3: $25,000 total funding - We'll host two on-line Q&A conference calls, the first one will be geared towards writers and will talk about the craft and business side of writing. The other will be geared toward readers and talk about Michael's writing process, past works, and what's coming up in the future. We'll take questions both during and before the call, and we'll record them so people can watch even if they aren't available when they air.
     
  • GOAL #2: REACHED: $20,000 total funding - A number of people have been emailing and asking whether the bookmarks would be signed. Well, I hadn't planned on it, but I'm willing to take the extra effort. So, let's make that our next stretch goal shall we? 
     
  • GOAL #1 REACHED: $5,000 over funding ($16,360) - if we reach this level we'll make an  Age of Swords bookmark and it to the orders. We already have an Age of Myth and an Age of War bookmark so this will complete the set (and any orders with those other books will have their corresponding bookmarks so your books and your bookmarks will match)!

So, what is this book about?  Well, here's the marketing copy from the jacket flap:

In Age of Myth, fantasy master Michael J. Sullivan launched readers on an epic journey of magic and adventure, heroism and betrayal, love and loss. Now the thrilling saga continues as the human uprising is threatened by powerful enemies from without—and bitter rivalries from within.

Raithe, the God Killer, may have started the rebellion by killing a Fhrey, but long-standing enmities dividing the Rhunes make it all but impossible to unite against the common foe. And even if the clans can join forces, how will they defeat an enemy whose magical prowess renders them indistinguishable from gods?

The answer lies across the sea in a faraway land populated by a reclusive and dour race who feel nothing but disdain for both Fhrey and mankind. With time running out, Persephone leads the gifted young seer Suri, the Fhrey sorceress Arion, and a small band of misfits in a desperate search for aid—a quest that will take them into the darkest depths of Elan where an ancient adversary waits, as fearsome as it is deadly.

So, that may sound great, but is the book any good? Well, I think so, but then again I might be a bit biased. ;-) But Age of Swords has received excellent ratings from others who have read it.  There are more than 15,000 ratings/reviews from sites such as Goodreads, Amazon, and Audible.com and more than 90% have rated it a 4- or 5-star and only 2.14% as a 1- or 2-star.

But why listen to others when you can check out the books for yourself?  Here are some links to sample chapters:

  • Sample Chapter of Age of Myth (Book #1 of the series)

  • Sample Chapter of Age of Swords (Book #2 of the series)

  • Sample Chapter for Age of War (Book #3 of the series)

Perks for this campaign are actually pretty straightforward: a hardcover edition of Age of Swords (and other books in the series if you want them, too).

Because you'll get the books directly from us, there are a number of additional perks we'll be providing to our backers.

  • 20% discount ($22 rather than $28 for all copies of the books sold in this campaign)
  • All books bought through this campaign will be signed.
  • You'll be acknowledged on my website as one of the people making this possible.
  • You'll receive a free short story (Little Wren and the Big Forest).
  • You'll receive screen savers featuring the work of Marc Simonetti (who created the cover).

There is one perk, however, that needs a bit more explanation, and that's "The Night in Avryln." You see, about a year and a half ago Robin (my wife) built us a cabin in the Shenandoah Valley (near Luray VA). We've moved there full-time and are loving it. When it was built, we put in two extra guest rooms (and also have a 2-room guest suite above the carriage house). We've had lots of visitors: family, friends, fans of my writing, and other writers. If you would like to come to "The Valley" and hang out with us we'd love you to visit as well. And if you're a writer, we'll even critique some of your work. There are a limited number of these rewards, and you must provide your own transportation to the area, but once you arrive, we'll take care of you well. Lots of food, drink, and the guest rooms are comfy. 

If you want to see more images of where you'll be staying, you can click here.

NOTE: You can choose your own date (we'll schedule based on first-come-first-picked), and it can be any time in 2018 or 2019. I do, however, recommend the warm months as the pool is wonderful, and there is plenty of surrounding things to do including hiking, horseback riding, canoeing, kayaking, fishing, mountain biking, tubing, zip lining, and there are also famous caves to check out.

I think it's important for you to know where your hard-earned cash is going. We structured this campaign to cover only our expenses, no profit whatsoever. But after funding, I'll have extra books to sell via my website (which will provide me an income going forward).  Here's what we need the money for:

  • Buying the original copies from Penguin Random House
  • Shipping them to a fulfillment center who will package and ship the books to you
  • Paying for one year of storage (because I doubt I'll sell out all the copies now)
  • Paying Indiegogo and credit card processing fees

The cost breakdown is as follows:

As for shipping fees from us to you, I have no interest in making money from that, so I set those fees to just barely cover our costs. You can click here to see how they were calculated. If you looked at the link, you'll see there is money for a fulfillment company to pick and ship the books, the shipping materials (boxes & envelopes), and the fees paid directly to the United States Postal Service. For our other crowd-funding projects, Robin used to package and ship the books herself (with the help of my daughter Sarah), but that's such a Herculean task (and she's developed wrist problems in addition to her knee and back issues), so I don't want her to do the shipping any longer.

The risks for this project couldn't be smaller. Age of Swords already exists (and was produced by the largest publishing company in the world), more than 250,000 copies of books in the series have been sold, and I've already set up a fulfillment company to ship orders. All I have to do is sign the copies. I guess there is some risk that the books will be involved in a crash during transportation to the fulfillment house, but if that happens, I'll gladly refund all payments received.

Oh, and just to be clear. Full funding means I buy all the books, but a partial funding means I'll buy as many books as the funds allow, but no matter what the funding level everyone who pledges WILL get their books, so no worries on that front. 

Well, I think that about covers everything. Oh, except to say I've run several other crowd-funding campaigns in the past and they have gone amazingly well. You can check out the comments and updates to see what the backers have to say with regard to my responsiveness and deliverability on those projects:

  • Disappearance of Winter's Daughter | 2,075 backers | $80,332 raised
  • The Death of Dulgath | 1,750 backers | $73,163 raised
  • Hollow World | 861 backers | $30,857 raised

I do hope you'll check out the book and help me get these hardcovers away from the price gougers and into the hands of readers at a reasonable price. As always, I thank you for your support.

Oh, and if you already have the book(s), don't like hardcovers, or just don't have the funds right now, please consider sharing this campaign with your friends and family by posting through social media.

story:
Story of My Book

Hurt by the Sun is a poetry book that explores the intersection of love and loss, and the process of healing and growing. From emotions of pure joy and happiness to moments of heartbreak and sadness, these poems dive into the idea that we, as humans, aren’t defined by a single moment or event, but instead we are a collection of experiences and memories that shape who we are and who we are becoming.

My name is D.W. Alexander and I am the author of Hurt by the Sun. Over the last couple years, I’ve spent a lot of time reflecting on the process of continued personal growth and the importance of being open and vulnerable. Whether it’s in relationships, friendships or in our professional lives, being authentic helps us make connections and improve the moments we share with others. These realizations motivated me to write and publish this collection of poetry.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will feel connected to, or understood by, one of the words, phrases or poems. Each poem is an opportunity to self-reflect about your own story and your own perspective — while also lending the notion that we aren’t alone in our shared life experiences. I hope you feel inspired to tear down your own walls, and share and connect with the people in your life; so that you may feel and love fearlessly.

In this book, you’ll join me in using words carefully scattered on a page to evoke distinct aspects and emotions of loss, healing and the process of self-realization through poems like:

  • “i do not remember,” which explores the challenging and painful process of finding yourself.
  • “Have you ever wept in rain?,” which explores the beauty of sadness found in the challenging moments of life.
  • “Show me true love,” which explores the integral importance of emotion, effort and honesty in relationships.
  • “Let me breathe,” which explores how we mold ourselves to fulfill the expectations of others.


You will enjoy this book if you appreciate moments of reflection, if you have gone through your own challenges and trials, if you love open and honest conversations, or if you are drawn to poetry.

Hurt by the Sun is for anyone who has experienced love and loss, for those looking to stop the cycle of repression emotions as well as for people seeking to continually develop the practice of sharing, expressing and being vulnerable.

I look forward to exploring all these topics, emotions and themes with my readers.

 

The Book Structure

Hurt by the Sun is written in 4 parts:

  • Sunburnt explores the themes of loss, regret and loneliness
  • Darkness explores the themes of pressure, intimacy, and self-doubt
  • Eclipse explores the themes of grieving, healing and introspection
  • Sunlight explores the themes of self-growth, self-empowerment and self-love

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The multiple editors I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats, etc.).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this fall.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgments section sent alongside my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction of my book and some additional sections from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

D. W. Alexander is a Duke University graduate currently residing in Washington, DC. He is an avid skier and sailor, Duke Basketball fanatic, and prides himself on being able to make the perfect fried egg.

He believes that we all strive for connection and compassion, but that we too often prevent ourselves from achieving both out of fear of being truly open and vulnerable. He maintains that by pushing through the discomfort, we are enabled to better not only the connections we share with others, but also the relationship we hold with ourselves. He wants to offer the perspective that the challenges and pain we all face in life aren’t meant to pull us down into the earth, but rather create opportunities to learn, grow and evolve into better versions of ourselves.

He has written poetry throughout his life and finds it the perfect medium to tackle complex emotions, feelings and experiences that can’t be fully expressed in traditional writing. Poetry allows an unfiltered, raw expression of thought and this book is his first step in sharing those ideas, images and emotions with readers. As we all progress through life, he wholeheartedly believes that it’s important to take a moment, reflect and recognize that we aren’t taking this journey alone.

For more information, you can connect with D. W. Alexander at dwalexanderpoetry@gmail.com and on Instagram (@d.w.alexander.poetry).
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #HurtByTheSun and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
D. W. Alexander

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgments section sent alongside my book.
You will receive early access to the Introduction of my book and some additional sections from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
And much more!

 
About the Author
D. W. Alexander is a Duke University graduate currently residing in Washington, DC. He is an avid skier and sailor, Duke Basketball fanatic, and prides himself on being able to make the perfect fried egg.He believes that we all strive for connection and compassion, but that we too often prevent ourselves from achieving both out of fear of being truly open and vulnerable. He maintains that by pushing through the discomfort, we are enabled to better not only the connections we share with others, but also the relationship we hold with ourselves. He wants to offer the perspective that the challenges and pain we all face in life aren’t meant to pull us down into the earth, but rather create opportunities to learn, grow and evolve into better versions of ourselves.He has written poetry throughout his life and finds it the perfect medium to tackle complex emotions, feelings and experiences that can’t be fully expressed in traditional writing. Poetry allows an unfiltered, raw expression of thought and this book is his first step in sharing those ideas, images and emotions with readers. As we all progress through life, he wholeheartedly believes that it’s important to take a moment, reflect and recognize that we aren’t taking this journey alone.For more information, you can connect with D. W. Alexander at dwalexanderpoetry@gmail.com and on Instagram (@d.w.alexander.poetry). 
International Preorders
For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #HurtByTheSun and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

 
Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,D. W. Alexander

story:
Short Summary

Quite frankly I am getting tired of hearing about young people killing each other! At first it seemed as though it was something that occurred mostly in major cities with high crime rates, but now, it is an epidemic that is out of control!  It needs to stop. The only way to thwart violence is through prevention. The only way to really succeed at prevention is through a change in one's environment. But what if neither of those are an option? Or what if it is too late and a person finds themselves already locked up and shackled? The only remaining option is to free the soul and to find inner peace! But honestly, this is a difficult task when there are walls in between those who want to help and those who want to be helped.

Words are POWER! And I wrote these words because I am a bonafide witness as to what a change of heart and a cleansing of the soul can do for a person. Not only does it make life good, it makes life great! Bottom line is that I made it out. I was fortunate enough by the grace of God to have been given opportunities that many of my homies were not. My life has not been easy and well, it has been, let's just say...colorful. But now I have a responsibility to share with EVERYONE a path towards mortal peace that passes all understanding.

I have a responsibility to share an ounce of prevention through my words, through knowledge, but above all, through heaven sent wisdom. I can guarantee one thing for certain. My book has something for anyone and everyone who will pick it up and read it. That is a promise!!!

Freedom Triumphant in War and Peace is a call to freedom and peace that passes all understanding. A personal freeing of the spirit that bears with it many rewards.  

We live in wondrous times... a time like this world has never seen. But with much change comes much uncertainty. It is time for us as people, and as a society, to return to basics or we risk losing all that we have built - including ourselves.  

Freedom Triumphant in War in Peace - The Ten Commandments: Today, Yesterday, and Tomorrow is a call towards reconciliation. It is a humble call to mortal peace of the highest caliber.

As a contributor and partner to this project you are becoming a light that begins to shine ever brighter! By contributing to this project you will no doubt be saving a strangers life and becoming a part of their success story! You will be directly responsible for helping a total stranger find peace, and for their positive contributions to our society, where there otherwise would be no hope. This I believe with all my heart!

The Author

Now, a little about me...

I am just a simple carpenter trying to become an author.  

I was born and raised in the fertile Yakima Valley of Washington State. I am the son of migrant farm workers, and my story stems from poverty-stricken humble beginnings. Learning how to navigate within a dysfunctional family, domestic abuse, gang violence, and the complex dichotomy of Christianity in the ghetto, I secretly found comfort in the bosom of education and the pursuit of knowledge.  

Though led to believe that academic failure was my only option, I would eventually persevere and complete four college degrees, culminating in a Master of Arts degree with high honors. I proudly attribute all of my success to a deep and personal relationship with Christ; and now, I am on a mission to inspire hope!  

As a self-proclaimed Renaissance Man, I pride myself in being a jack-of-all trades. I am happily married to my wife Jessica, and we enjoy our peace-filled country lifestyle nestled in the Palouse of Eastern Washington State.

What We Need & What You Get

I am shooting for $10,000 USD

Use of funds:

39% Pre-publication Costs: $3900

  • Graphic Design, cover, layout
  • Copyright, ISBN, Kindle Conversion
  • Content editing and copyediting

28% Indiegogo Perks (Rewards): $2800

  • Book printing
  • Shipping
  • Other reward production

33% FREE Book Distribution Technical and Marketing Costs: $3300

  • Distribution of FREE paperback copies in support of primary mission objective
  • Video Development, advertising
  • Indiegogo fees
  • Taxes

* Any funds above the set amount will be going directly to the distribution of FREE books

PERKS (Rewards)

From autographed books, to digital .pdf copies of the book, t-shirts, gourmet meals with the author chef, and his chef wife, world famous recipes, and many, many other perks and rewards that will be included in this campaign (even secret perks to be included in the swag bag). Be sure and read over them carefully! They are definitely worth their weight in gold!!!

The Impact

This will be a global impact! I have already begun writing the Spanish version of this book to fulfill the same mission! (More languages to come) 

Listen, I am the "go-to-guy" whenever someone has a problem. I enjoy people and I love to help people find their way in life and I ESPECIALLY love it when I can help someone find happiness. That is how YOU can know that this project will be a success. Guaranteed!

Risks & Challenges

There is absolutely NO RISK here!

And... quite frankly, I have survived many challenges to even make it to this point. To be completely honest, I should not even be alive today. NO JOKE! I almost died twice beginning of this winter ('17, '18). So let's just say, if I pulled through that and continue to move forward...nothing will get in the way of me fulfilling my mission. Just being honest.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please remember to get the word out! Share, share, share!!! We need to make our lights shine bright, and they shine brighter together. Thank you!

story:
Made in North Korea

Have you ever heard, used, or consumed a product made in North Korea? From one of the world's most closed, brutal, and repressive countries? 

I am starting a new book project about how a Sweden-based company called Noko Jeans tried to sell jeans produced in North Korea during the end of the 2000s. The idea was to initially sell the jeans in Stockholm at the PUB Department Store. 

This history is very interesting because it was the first and only attempt to sell North Korean-made jeans at the European market. The attempt and whole business idea gained a lot of publicity, including political debates about if it was morally right or not to sell products made in one of the world’s worst dictatorships under the control of a brutal government.

During the book writing process, I will focus on the following aspects:

- The original idea and PR

- The role of the North Korean embassy and government

- Trade 4 mining company

- Media publicity

- Political debates

- Documentary “Manevaurs in the Dark”

 

Support and rewards 

In order to have more free time for writing the book, I need around 10 000 Euro. As thanks for your donations, you will receive: 

- 5 - 10 EUR = Your name will be mentioned in the book's "thank you list". 

- 10 -20 EUR: Above plus, you will be able to read exclusive content via my  Substack blog 

- 20 EUR or more = you will receive a signed copy of the book 

 

The Impact

North Korea is one of the most repressive, inhumane, and brutal places in the world. One of my ambitions with the book is to analyze how much were creators of Noko Jeans aware of human rights abuses. Also, the book could become an interesting case when it comes to economic history and lessons learned from the world of business. 

 

Risks 

During my writing process, I may get sick for a longer period because of some disease (as Covid-19). In such a case,  I will not be able to finish the book before the end of 2022.  Hopefully, things will go in accordance with to plan. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share and tell the information about my book project to your friends, family members, and contacts.

story:
This beautifully illustrated children's book tells an emotional story about Alzheimer's Disease through the eyes of a granddaughter.

 

This delightful story opens with little Jamelah sharing her excitement for something she’s waited long and hard for--the Fair. The Day It Rained allows for an intimate peek into the world of Alzheimer’s Disease through the eyes of one little girl whose disappointment is surprisingly dissolved through the unexpected time she shares with her grandmother.

The book offers unique opportunities for open communication with young people about what it means to love someone with Alzheimer's. While aimed at the elementary school-aged crowd, It is my goal to use the book to touch the hearts of not only the children who read it, but their families and caretakers as well. I hope that this book presents you with thoughts of how to let go and love differently, enjoying those unplanned and unscripted moments when everything seems to have been turned upside down.

Dr. Yemonja Smalls received her doctorate at Louisiana State University in clinical psychology, completed her internship at Johns Hopkins School of Medicine, and has worked in numerous clinical settings with children and adults with intellectual and developmental disability. Yemonja has an extensive background in the treatment of behavioral disorders, and has worked for over 15 years with adults and children with developmental disabilities.

“Dr. Y,” as affectionately known, is a self taught artist who gives birth to creations in acrylic paint and other mediums. Vibrant and restorative, Yemonja’s work focuses on human relationships.

“The Day It Rained” is Yemonja's first self-illustrated and written children’s book. Motivated by her own unique experiences with her grandmother who had Alzheimer's, she felt compelled to share another view of the devastating disease.

Hardcover book- A signed hardcover will be shipped at every level at and beyond your $30 contribution.

Open and Signed Limited Edition prints-At noted backing levels, you can get either open edition or signed limited edition canvas prints of one or all four selected works of art from the book.  Each limited edition is numbered and signed by the artist.

Peace Be Still

Braidin'

The original acrylic painting "Braidin" (36x48 gallery wrapped) will be shipped to the $5000 backer-see levels! See some of her other artwork here http://www.YemonjaSmalls.com and at http://www.ImJustHuman.com.


Love Grand

Grandma's Hat

 

The original acrylic painting "Braidin" (36x48 gallery wrapped) will be shipped to the $5000 backer! See some of her other artwork here http://www.YemonjaSmalls.com.

uh

Prints:

Each of the four pieces will come sized 18x24, and if a signed limited edition canvas is chosen, will come stretched and ready to hang.

The funds raised will be used to ensure successful fulfillment of shipped printed books to all backers. Book and art printing, shipping and marketing costs are included, including book launch event.

Risks and challenges

Yes, there are always unforeseen challenges and possible setbacks to accomplishing any goal. As the book is nearing completion, the biggest issue to ensure timely fulfillment involves successful shipment of printed books. The book needs to go through a final editing process which is expected to occur at the end of July. The limited edition and open edition prints are already prepared and are ready for signature.

I need your support in order to make this publication a reality!

EVERY DONATION COUNTS!

story:
Short biography

I am a graphic designer, teacher, writer, and publisher currently based in Switzerland. To find out more about me, please visit http://brigitteschuster.com/about


About the project

Between 2010 and 2013, I interviewed thirteen prominent contemporary book designers from the Netherlands: Joost Grootens, Karen Polder, Ron van Roon, Françoise Berserik, Armand Mevis, Walter Nikkels, Hansje van Halem, Robbert and Oscar Schrover, Caroline de Lint, Bram de Does, Tessa van der Waals, Adriaan de Jonge. Coloured illustrations of the book designers and their works are featured in this highly collectable, 300 page book.

The selected book designers represent different generations and are shaped by a wide diversity of experience and backgrounds. Some are detail-oriented typographers, others rather conceptual graphic designers. Some use the book as a platform for self-expression while others see themselves simply as craftspeople. Overall, it provides a unique perspective on today's Dutch book design scene, exploring diverging opinions and practices of interest to a broad international community of designers and book enthusiasts.

To find out more details about the book, please visit http://brigitteschuster.com/book-designers-from-the-netherlands


What you as a contributor will help me to achieve

    I have decided to release this book independently together with your help in a limited edition (300 copies) to cover the costs of publication (expected April 2014).

    Helping me with your contribution and enabling the publication of this book is 100 % beneficial to you and the community: You pay in advance for the production costs of the book you will hold in your hands a few months later. It helps me, as a publisher, to face a lower risk for the costs of image preparation, printing, paper, bookbinding and shipping. I have personally assumed the costs of writing, research, travel expenses, graphic design work as well as professional editing services.

    If you are unable to contribute to the project by purchasing a copy, please help promote my project through your personal network by spreading the word and sharing this link:

    http://igg.me/at/book-designers-from-the-netherlands


    What you get

    Along with your copy of the book, you will receive an exclusive audio version containing excerpts from the interview recordings. If you like, you will get your named printed in the book as a sponsor. 


    About past projects

    I have successfully funded and completed other projects. Please visit http://brigitteschuster.com/

story:
Sydney Montessori Literature Festival 2014

Sydney Montessori School is holding its inaugural annual Literature Festival between 30th April and 2nd May 2014.

3 days of author and illustrator talks, panels, workshops, book signings and special events for all ages, including school groups, teachers, parents, and the general public from the Sutherland Shire and Sydney-wide.

Our programme guide is filling fast with wonderful presenters.

We are seeking crowd funding to make this the best event possible for our wider community.

This will be a wonderful and important event and we hope you want to support us and share this experience.

How did it begin?

It all began with a passing conversation with a stranger (no, not that kind!). While chatting with a grandmother in a queue somewhere about children, schools and our work at the school parents and friends association (P&F), she mentioned an annual school literature festival in Queensland. And that was it - I had the light-bulb moment - Bing! All the elements I am passionate about - literature, literacy and education - all tied up in one exciting event. Any event that makes a contribution to improved literacy, which brings schools and the wider community together, and encourages young people to read, write - and think - is a triumph. We can do this, I thought - and the adventure began.

How the funds will be used

As you can imagine there are a number of costs and logistics associated with staging such an event. We anticipate receiving around 3000 visitors to this event just this year.

The project total budget is $25,000 and we are working with corporate and other sponsors and partners to help with major expenses. But your help is essential.

Author and performer fees, visitor prizes, marketing, printing, photography, IT expenses, catering, marquee and other event hire, construction, audio visual needs, risk assessment requirements - these are just some of the financial challenges we need to meet.

In other words, these funds will go towards all aspects of getting our school “Festival Ready” as a venue for an unforgettable event.

If we smash our budget, the extra funds will be used for improving facilities, infrastructure and events for our future annual literature festivals.

Big challenges!

Being our inaugural Literature Festival (not our first festival, but the first in literature) and run completely by volunteers, carries its own types of challenges - time management, work commitments, event management and budget constraints to name a few - along with the challenge of encouraging event participation from a wider group than our own school community.

Meeting expectations!

Meeting our own expectations!

However, we have been thrilled with the support and response so far to this event. Authors, publishers and many others have been fantastic in their support.

All that support pushes us forward. We will make this festival happen and, with your help, we will all make a valuable cultural and educational contribution to our community.

The team

Dr Deborah Browne - Volunteer, Event Director

Deborah is a strong advocate for literary education, and sees the Festival as a perfect fit for encouraging literacy, and a joy of reading. In her real job, she is an Emergency Medicine doctor; her full-time, volunteer job is as our tireless Festival Director. She reads widely, and a little bird told us she is secretly a writer, too...

Julio Goncalves - Volunteer, IT Director

Julio has some 20+ years of experience in IT and a strong hold on project management. He’s got a persistent and talkative attitude. Very talkative! His literary taste ranges from science and technology to... technology and science.

Raquel Charet - School Principal

Raquel is our in-house Montessori guru. Our Queen of Lists - she keeps us in check, feet on the ground. “Yes, just do it!” - nice to have someone that will surely tell us how it is. “Is it done already?!". Her book preferences range from anything to anything really.

Linley Caetan - Volunteer, Community Support

Linley gets straight to the point. "Literacy is important. Who wouldn't want to support literacy?". Master of the 45-minute meeting. He is driving our community campaign.  "What are the next steps? When?" Think fast!

Sam - High School Student, Video Production

Huge thanks to Sam for taking the time between classes to film and produce the video.

Caroline Fonda - Crowd funding Support

Many thanks to Caroline for the initial text for this crowd funding and the ideas on perks. Nice ones!

Common ground

Most of us are parents at the school, some of us work here. Our bond is our commitment to make the school the best and most fulfilling place for our kids and to contribute to our broader community.

Other ways you can help

Of course, the more people know about the festival the better.

Spread the news!

Comments, likes, shares, email, general support, tell your friends... come along!

smsliteraturefestival@gmail.com

school groups, teachers, parents, and the general 
public from the Sutherland Shire and Sydney-wide. Our programme guide is filling fast with wonderful presenters.We are seeking crowd funding to make this the best event possible for our wider community.This will be a wonderful and important event and we hope you want to support us and share this experience.How did it begin?It all began with a passing conversation with a stranger (no, not that kind!). While chatting with a grandmother in a queue somewhere about children, schools and our work at the school parents and friends association (P&F), she mentioned an annual school literature festival in Queensland. And that was it - I had the light-bulb moment - Bing! All the elements I am passionate about - literature, literacy and education - all tied up in one exciting event. Any event that makes a contribution to improved literacy, which brings schools and the wider community together, and encourages young people to read, write - and think - is a triumph. We can do this, I thought - and the adventure began.How the funds will be usedAs you can imagine there are a number of costs and logistics associated with staging such an event. We anticipate receiving around 3000 visitors to this event just this year.The project total budget is $25,000 and we are working with corporate and other sponsors and partners to help with major expenses. But your help is essential.Author and performer fees, visitor prizes, marketing, printing, photography, IT expenses, catering, marquee and other event hire, construction, audio visual needs, risk assessment requirements - these are just some of the financial challenges we need to meet.In other words, these funds will go towards all aspects of getting our school “Festival Ready” as a venue for an unforgettable event.If we smash our budget, the extra funds will be used for improving facilities, infrastructure and events for our future annual literature festivals.Big challenges!Being our inaugural Literature Festival (not our first festival, but the first in literature) and run completely by volunteers, carries its own types of challenges - time management, work commitments, event management and budget constraints to name a few - along with the challenge of encouraging event participation from a wider group than our own school community.Meeting expectations!Meeting our own expectations!However, we have been thrilled with the support and response so far to this event. story:
Any Questions?

As well as being the subject of a lecture, entitled The Depressive Dandy, at Berlin's Humboldt University, the Art Brut lyrics of Eddie Argos have received plenty of accolades;

'Full of the bathetic genius, that English pop used to excel in' - The Guardian.

'Lines that Larkin might not have sniffed at' - Word Magazine.

'Truly thrilling post-Britpop art-punk monologues' - Drowned In Sound.

'One of his generations great poets of the mundane' - Spin Magazine.

While his singing voice has been described as;

'Torturous and tiresome' - Q Magazine. 

In an attempt to reach a new audience (of people that might like his words, but do not like to be shouted at) Eddie Argos's lyrics have now been compiled together into a paperback book.

Any Questions? The Complete Art Brut 2003 - 2013

Contains all of the lyrics written within the first ten years of Art Brut - including bonus tracks and B-Sides. 

PLUS 

  • An essay on each Art Brut album
  • Illustrations
  • Footnotes
  • Time Line Of An Artist

As well as a Foreword from the brilliant  Luke Wright.


Lo-Fi Punk Rock Motherfucking Label

Any Questions? The Complete Art Brut 2003 - 2013 will be the first book published on the Lo-Fi Punk Rock Motherfucking label. The label (curated by Eddie Argos) will not concentrate solely on releasing books, it will also release other items from the Lo-Fi Punk Rock Motherfucking Arts. This includes Fanzines, Paintings, Records and whatever else Eddie Argos feels falls into this category. 

How You Can Help

By funding this book, your money will go directly towards this new label for the Lo-Fi Punk Rock Motherfucking Arts.

What your donation will get you.

  • £20 - a signed, numbered copy of a first edition of Any Questions? by Eddie Argos
  • £40 - a signed, numbered copy of a first edition of Any Questions? by Eddie Argos, also, a painting in acrylic on canvas - 12.7cm x 17.7cm - of the LFPRMF!  logo, as well as the lyrics from your favourite Art Brut song handwritten into the back of the book by Eddie Argos
  • £90 - a signed, numbered copy of a first edition of Any Questions? by Eddie Argos, also, a large painting in acrylic on canvas - 30cm x 40cm - of the LFPRMF! logo, plus the lyrics from your favourite Art Brut song handwritten by Eddie Argos into the back of the book, a certificate of thanks, as well as, your name printed into every book as a 'Patron Of The Motherfucking Arts'

The preservation of lo fi punk rock motherfucking art is a global concern, so all prices include postage to anywhere in the world.

Our aim is small I hope you can help us exceed it. MOTHERFUCKERS!

EDDIE ARGOS

Institute for the lo fi punk rock motherfucking arts. November 27th 2013.

story:
Angel Wellington is a highly-favored teacher, preacher, workshop leader, emcee, and motivational speaker.  She is one of the Pastors at Descending Dove Christian Center, in Wilmington, NC, and ever-growing faith-based fellowship, making a permanent impact on the community.

     An early interest in televangelism led Angel to study Mass Communications at Norfolk State University.  But the King’s business required haste, and a last minute speaking engagement revealed what others had long suspected, a call to communicate the message to masses. 

!

     Spirit-led and destiny-driven, she and her husband have decided to approach ministry from the vantage point of their personal gifts and abilities, anointed by the Spirit.  She sings, acts, mimes, writes, choreographs, directs as well as plays musical instruments such as the piano.  A personal passion to return the performing arts back to its Giver (Jesus), her ministry utilizes the arts to present the Gospel in clear, convicting and sometimes comedic form. Though she has participated in live recordings, toured with a gospel musical, and hosted her own radio program, the call to pastor has taken priority and produced lasting effect.



 

        As an English teacher in Norfolk VA, her passion for education, children, and fine arts, motivated her to write Christian material in the form of children’s books, dramas, and songs.

 

 

     Her straightforward, up-beat, down-to-earth presentation of the Gospel is undeniably contagious and understandably effective.  The message is real, relevant and relational, not soon to be forgotten.  Many children have been lead to Christ and taught how to live a life pleasing to Him by Pastor Angel’s gifts and creative teaching.



 

 

          In 2010, Angel brought her first children’s book to life, by turning it into a dramatic presentation that the children from our ministry were able to be a part of.  The night was concluded with a standing ovation.  In 2011, she took an ordinary banquet and turned it into a mystery dinner theater in salute of our military soldiers.  In July 2012, her latest endeavor came to life by combining poetry, drama, and the Word of God using the alphabets A through Z.  She named it LOGOs.         

 

          Pastor Angel’s desire is to help people live a prosperous life; physically, emotionally, spiritually, & financially.  The bible says “people perish by the lack of knowledge” and in a society full of mass media & technology, reading is essential.  Our children need good Godly material in order to have a brighter tomorrow.  Your donation, to Help An Angel Write, will ensure our kids have an awesome future in God.

 

 

Baby Doves

 

Things Angel need to Complete and Publish Book
 
  • Printing Cost
  • Illustrations Cost
  • Editing Cost
  • Marketing Cost
  • Shipping Cost
  • Publicist Cost
 
Additional Cost to Help An Angel Write
 
  • Rehearsal Space
  • Video Equipment
  • Professional Sound System
  • Professional Recording Package
  • Props and Costumes

story:
The Problem

In Cameroon, Africa, books are scarce--especially the good ones. Which means few Catholics have access to quality spiritual reading. Fr. Linus, who is studying at one of the Cameroon seminaries, explains:

"One of the key problems the Church in Cameroon is facing, as in many parts of Africa, is that Christians do not read. And if they do, it's very thin. Most know very little about the Catholic faith and the situation is worst among the young people."

But what if we could change that, patricularly in the seminaries? What if we could provide good Catholic books to every future-priest in the country?

With eBooks and new media, I think we can.

 

The Movement

Working with the seminarians themselves, we've decided the best solution is to go digital. So we're providing one CD for each seminarian in Cameroon, loaded with Catholic content that is accessible wherever he goes, regardless of the computer he's using or whether it has Internet.

Lighthouse Catholic Media will be producing and shipping the CD's to Africa for roughly $2 per CD. That's $4,000 total, which we could have raised by working with large charities.

However we’ve chosen a different route.

We want this project to be an experiment in new media solidarity. We want to crowdsource this work of mercy and we want you to join the movement.

For just $2, you can provide one CD for one priest, and put a ton of resources in his pocket. For just a couple bucks you can say with the rest of us, "we" did this, "we" helped make this happen.

It's super easy. Just click"Contribute Now" at the top of the page and you'll join the movement within seconds.

Also, check out the different perks on the right which have been generously donated by our sponsors. We're sending out books, CD's, DVD's and more all to say "thank you" for being a part of this.


*IMPORTANT* In order to receive a perk, choose the one you want and click the "Claim This Perk" button underneath it. If you just make a general donation, Indiegogo won't necessarily register you for a perk.

 

So what's on the CD?

Great question! Through the support of New Advent, Our Sunday Visitor, Aquinas and More Bookstore, and the Libreria Editrice Vatican, we've collected a ton of digital content including:

  • The Holy Bible in English and Latin
  • The complete writings of the Church fathers
  • The full Catholic Encyclopedia
  • St. Thomas Aquinas' Summa Theologiae
  • Several Church documents and encyclicals
  • Apologia Pro Vita Sua (Cardinal John Henry Newman)
  • Heretics (G.K. Chesterton)
  • How to Make Homilies Better, Briefer, and Bolder (Fr. Alfred McBride)
  • Lord of the World (Robert Hugh Benson)
  • Men of Brave Heart: The Virtue of Courage in the Priestly Life (Archbishop Jose Gomez)
  • Orthodoxy (G.K. Chesterton)
  • Pensees (Blaise Pascal)
  • Priests for the Third Millennium (Cardinal Timothy Dolan)
  • The Church and New Media (Brandon Vogt)
  • The Great Teachers (Pope Benedict XVI)
  • The Little Flowers of St. Francis (St. Francis of Assisi)
  • The Priest: A Bridge to God (Pope Benedict XVI)
  • The Spiritual Exercises (St. Ignatius of Loyola)
  • The Story of a Soul (St. Therese of Lisieux)
 

Other Ways You Can Help

We definitely need money to make this happen, but even if you can't donate there are several other ways to help:

Pray. We don't mean this flippantly. This project was birthed in prayer and continues to bathe in it, so saying a quick prayer would be huge. Prayer, after all, is more powerful than money. Please pray not just for the project's success but for all those in formation around the world.

Share. If you're on Facebook or Twitter, share this page with your friends and family. Just click the share buttons under the video at the top of this page. If you have your own blog or website, embed the YouTube trailer or mention the project there. You'll also find some great graphics and banners under the Gallery tab at the top of the page.

Support our sponsors. This project is only possible because several people donated time and resources. If you support them, we can do even more in the future:

  • NewAdvent.org - Check New Advent each day for the best Catholic articles arounds the web. You'll also find the Summa, the Catholic Encyclopedia, the writings of the Church Fathers, and for just $30 you can have your own CD with all of that great content.
  • Our Sunday Visitor - The world's largest English-language Catholic publisher offers many great resources. From the OSV Newsweekly to helpful books and magazines, there's something for everyone. Check out their newest books and find something you like.
  • Aquinas and More - The largest Catholic online store has thousands of products ranging from books and videos to chalices and church furnishings. They also have a great selection of low-priced Catholic ebooks and audiobooks.
  • Lighthouse Catholic Media - Lighthouse is renowned for their magnificent audio talks from speakers like Scott Hahn, Mother Teresa, Fulton Sheen, Fr. Benedict Groeschel, and more. For just a few bucks you can subscribe to their CD of the month and MP3 of the month clubs and have great talks deilvered to you every few weeks.
  • Word on Fire - The global media ministry founded by Fr. Robert Barron has one simple goal: to evangelize the culture. And that's just what they do through their blog, YouTube videos, and cultural commentaries. Head over to the Word on Fire Store to pick up your copy of Fr. Barron's epic "CATHOLICISM" DVD series or one of his many books, CDs, or DVDs.
 

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

Q: Why CDs?

A: Most of the Cameroon seminarians have access to computers, but Internet use is spotty at best. The CDs enable them to carry the content wherever they go, whichever computer they're on.

Q: Can I have a copy of the CD?

A: Unfortunately, due to copyright restrictions, the CDs are only available for the seminarians in Africa. But Kevin Knight at NewAdvent.org sells his own CD for $30 that has much of the content.

Q: What happens if you raise more than $4,000?

A: If we raise more than we planned, the goal is to create even more CDs and send them to other seminarians across Africa.

Q: When I donate, do I get *all* the perks beneath my amount?

A: Unfortunately, not right now. You'll only receive the perk immediately below your donation amount. So for example, if you donate $60 you'll just recceive the "Church and New Media" book, not the other items as well.

Q: When will I receive my perk?

A: Once the campaign ends on June 30, we'll begin shipping items out. You should receive your items no later than August 1.

 

Special Thanks

Several people helped make this project happen, but I want to especially thank Rozann Carter, Production Assistant at Word on Fire, for creating the awesome graphics. Special thanks also to Elliot Foley at Lighthouse Catholic Media for his patience and generosity in coordinating the shipping and logistics. And of course, thanks to Fr. Linus Patem for dreaming this whole thing up with me. You guys are awesome!

story:
Hi there, I'm Bob Villoria (R.M.Villoria) and back in 1992 a floodgate of stories began flowing from my mind. As I feverishly wrote night after night, I completed two novels and their corresponding screenplays. But as happens, "Life goes on while we're busy making other plans", and so some years have passed. But now I'm retired and want to get these and so many more of my stories published. Last year was challenging in that my wife underwent major surgery (no insurance) and thus publishing money is virtually non existent. I could use some help in turning things around since I'm quite confident that this first volume of short stories is going to be well received. 

King? Koontz? They may make you want to leave the lights on, but now a new dimension in horror writing is about to be unleashed. Departing from his usual ghost related stories, R.M.Villoria takes you on a journey through one woman's mind as she is drawn back to where her horror began.

Although abstract, trans-personal relationships do exist, as you read on page after page, you may need to ask yourself "Does someone I know experience this?"

Please donate to get this story and many more into your hands.

I have been lucky to have had a number of people validate my works as particularly good reading.

"I had to leave the lights on after reading "Shadows" - Eilene G.
"A good read" - Ron Shusett / Total Recall 1 & 2, Above the Law
"You worry me Bob" - Catherine Day (After reading "Going Home") (btw, I considered that to be a great compliment)

Getting this first volume published and into the hands of avid readers will assuredly be my "swan song" after all these years. If you are unable to help yourself, perhaps you will share my efforts with your friends, neighbors, total strangers you accost on the streets, anyone... Thank you for your generosity. Like it says above...It may not be potato salad, but it will satisfy your hunger for a good read.

(For those who know what I'm talking about)
