Summary
A while back, Manuel and Molly appeared in my apartment. They're both sentient plush animals, apparently from a parallel universe (Earth-33, to be precise). Manuel is a lobster, and Molly is a sheep: Manuel's BFF, and also his accountant. 
Since February 2017, Manuel has made it impossible for me to socialize, have a relationship, or even enjoy a quiet evening at home. From using my credit card to buy "anti-prawn devices" (read: cocktail umbrellas), to jumping out of the drawer and scaring the living daylights out of EVERY SINGLE DATE who comes over, my level of done with Manuel is very high. 
With Molly's help, I figured out how to get rid of Manuel. 
Apparently, Manuel can only return to Earth-33 if this book is read by at least 420 people. 
I need your help to do this. 
 
These are some other reasons why I'm writing and publishing this book:

I am a Cylon, and my Cylon therapist said I should publish a book. Do you have any idea how much worse anxiety is with countless copies of yourself out there?
Manuel (the lobster) will not shut up until I publish this book, because everything is always about him. ALL THE TIME.
I will be eternally grateful to you for ending the current misery of waking up to feel Manuel's grubby, furry lobster claws on my face, pestering me about writing and publishing his story.

(Manuel also likes throwing loud parties and inviting questionable wildlife into my home, including very drunk mermaids. And no, he does not pay rent.)Please, please help me get rid of this dratted crustacean once and for all.
 

What I Need & What You Get
Apart from my sanity, this is what I need:

I need at least 420 people to read this book. According to Molly, this is the magic number that's needed for them to go back to Earth-33, where Manuel will presumably continue to pester my Earth-33 counterpart.
Dear Earth-33 version of me, I apologize in advance, but I need my life back. #sorrynotsorry

The dazzling array of perks I have laid out include being featured in the book (using your own name or a character name of your choice). This is an excellent opportunity to be a part of inter-parallel universe travel without the help of psychotropic substances. It's also cheaper, hooray!

What you get: Apart from the perk you've purchased, all backers will be mentioned in the acknowledgment section, with your preferred name. You can make up a name if you like, but please don't make me say "Thanks, Khaleesi!" 7 times on one page. 

The story: You'll find out how on earth Manuel arrived here at Earth-42, and the palaver that my predecessor on Earth-11, Penny Lane, had to go through to get rid of him. (Yes, that is really her name.) 
You'll get updates throughout the campaign, mostly about how Manuel is continuing to make my life a misery. 

Post-campaign: you'll get updates on the book production, as well as delightful visual anecdotes of how Manuel is cheerfully continuing to ruin my life.

Where the funds go if I exceed my basic and stretch goals: From whatever's left after covering my basic and stretch goal costs, 11% will go to a literacy NGO that you, the backers, will choose via a poll. The rest will go towards offsetting the enormous debt that Manuel has racked up on my credit cards, along with more sessions with my Cylon therapist.
Oh, you wanted numbers? Okay then. Molly has some numbers for you.

 


Basic goal:
Interior layout for ebook and print, cover design, print costs for backer copies and distribution on all major online retailers: USD $1,400
A Goodreads giveaway for 42 print copies: USD $600
Total: USD $2,000



Stretch goal (up to USD $8,000)
Everything in the basic goal plus:
Developmental editing so that more people will enjoy reading this book, review it positively, and tell people about it, thus getting me closer to the minimum goal of 420 readers needed to rid myself of this meddlesome lobster: USD $4,400
Marketing budget boost, spread out over 3 months: USD $1,200
Sending copies of the book to 30 book bloggers and reviewers, including printing and shipping: USD $400
Total: USD $8,000



 

The Impact
This is how your contribution will help me and other people on Earth-42:

SRSLY PLEASE, help me out. Manuel has ruined about 83 dates (and counting) for me already. He keeps appearing at awkward times and throwing his voice from the drawer that I've stuffed him in. A squeaky voice yelling "Kill the prawns!" in the middle of a make-out session is super not fun. Believe me.
^^There was one time Manuel did this when I was about to get erm, romantic with a guy who looked exactly like Pedro Pascal. I never saw NotPedro again (after he fled, screaming). Do you have any idea how difficult it is to find a Pedro Pascal lookalike in Singapore?

This is my first time crowdfunding. Not my first time writing a book, though. (You can read it here.)
You can trust me to get rid of the lobster once I hit the 420-reader target. Bye, Manuel!

 

Risks & Challenges
These are the risks and challenges in my quest to remove Manuel from my life and my apartment:
If Manuel had told me about the 420-reader threshold, this campaign would be moot, because he would totally be lying. However, Molly has verified that this is the magic number needed for both the creatures to go back to Earth-33, so I think we're good.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you know anyone who can travel to parallel universes, remember: sharing is caring!
If you don't know a parallel universe traveller, please share this campaign anyway.
If funding this campaign isn't your thing, that's fine. All I ask is that you read  and review the book when it's published, so that the confounded crustacean can be on his way back to Earth-33 yesterday. 

 
Get updates on the campaign page or here:
https://fb.me/manuelthelobster
https://www.instagram.com/manuel.thelobster/

One of her heels was threatening to abscond forever, and it was about two wobbles away from breaking. Penny thought about the annoying ads for mints which contained unnecessary amounts of cheeriness and impractical advice about shoe-related emergencies, and wondered exactly what narcotics the models had been on.“Miss! I have a message for you!” someone babbled behind her. A clammy hand landed on her shoulder. It was so slippery with sweat that Penny managed to shrug her way out of the unwanted contact almost instantly.She spun on her heel, which broke — presumably out of sheer spite. The effect of her hostility was somewhat ruined as she awkwardly balanced on one leg to break off the offending heel — just like in those implausible mint ads. She wanted to scream, but the front of the frozen yoghurt shop was possibly not the place to do this. It was more of a horrid banshee wail so awful that it had probably ripped a hole in the space-time continuum. Or at least, Penny thought so. This might seem an unkind assessment, but Penny Lane had been subjected to a ridiculous number of unimaginative Beatles-related jokes, puns, and comments about her name for twenty-four years. For some reason, he thought that forcing all his employees to wear costumes for a different theme every Friday was a good idea. Savage words like ‘team morale’ and ‘interdepartmental dynamics’ had been thrown around recklessly in several agonising meetings about Friday Fundays. How exactly this would help a team of seven people at a paperclip distribution company was a mystery for the ages.Today wasn’t just any Friday Funday. It was the Beatles-themed Friday Funday. Bob from Marketing greeted Penny with a level of enthusiasm bordering on insanity. Penny considered his incessant cheerfulness a grave personal insult, and made the effort to be laconic when interacting with him.“Penny! We renamed the goldfish!” Bob said, almost vibrating with joy.No, thought Penny. Please don’t say it. Don’t-“We named them John, Paul, George, and Ringo!” Bob giggled. He then skipped off to torture someone else in the office with his excessive happiness.Penny surveyed the scene in the office while a silent scream began in her head. It did not stop: the office had turned into her personal hell. There were about four Ringo Starrs, one Yoko Ono, and Beatles-themed decorations everywhere.Miranda from Sales swanned over to the receptionist’s desk. She was dressed as Yoko Ono, and inexplicably, was wearing dramatic fake eyelashes that were compromising her center of gravity.“Penny!” she squealed. “Darling, you poor thing! Did you forget about this week’s theme?”Penny wondered, not for the first time, if there was a supply of Prozac in the office pantry that no one had told her about. Miranda blinked rapidly at her, causing a very small breeze.“Miranda, I think Paul is flirting with the intern again,” Penny said, edging towards the cover of her reception desk. Miranda’s head swiveled towards a gaggle of Paul McCartneys.“Which Paul? Paul, Paul or one of the McCartneys?” Miranda asked.At this point, Penny Lane mentally ran through a number of ways to escape this nightmare, some more violent than others. We need you to come to the hospital and sign some forms,” the woman said, stifling another mighty yawn. “It’s urgent,” she added.“I see. I’ll be there in thirty minutes. Bye,” Penny said. story:
What is the campaign about?

It's about raising funds to publish Lucifer -- a witty fantasy that flips the classic image of Heaven on its head. What if Heaven was a home to a corporation in charge of designing Earth and all its inhabitants? And what if Lucifer was simply assigned his devilish role by God Himself? This story is for anyone who likes fantasy, dry humor, and stories that stir the imagination, and I hope you'll consider contributing to its success.

What's the novel about?

The angels of God's office complex turn out amazing projects, the greatest being the universe, a work in progress. Lucifer, a lowly angel working on human personality, gets summoned by God, who offers him a big promotion. All Lucifer has to do is rebel against Him to get it. Reluctantly accepting the challenge of rebelling against the all-seeing, all-knowing Creator, Lucifer finds himself butting heads with the other angels to see it through. Things start coming together until God announces the project's release date. But, the universe isn't ready; humans aren't even ready! Everything spirals out of control as Lucifer attempts to sort it all out.

Can I read some if it?

“Well, what do I have to do?” Lucifer asked immediately.

“Rebel,” God answered simply.

Lucifer said nothing, waiting for the Lord to finish His thought, but He said nothing more. Lucifer eventually asked, “What exactly do You mean?”

“I mean exactly what I said.” God paused again before adding, “Rebel…against Me.”

Lucifer grew more confused. “But, how would I be rebelling if You are telling me to do it?”

“Don’t ask; just do it.”

“Okay.”

They sat in silence once more. Lucifer fidgeted, wanting to get more information out of the Lord. Eventually, he spoke, “But…”

“What is it?” inquired God, clasping His hands together and resting His chin upon them.

“But You know everything, right?”

“Right.”

“And You can see everything.” Lucifer hesitated once more before adding, “Right?”

“Right.”

“Then how can I rebel?”

“Don’t ask. Just figure it out.”

“Okay.”

Lucifer paused again, his mind befuddled.  Grasping at straws, Lucifer asked, “When should I do this?”

“Surprise Me,” God said.

Who is the author?

Alexander was born and raised in Thunder Bay, Ontario. He lived on residence in Toronto, Ontario while attending the Faculty of Pharmacy at the University of Toronto between 2006 and 2010. While there, he discovered his love of writing, spending much of his free time writing short stories, one of which he expanded to arrive at his first novel, Lucifer. After graduating, Alexander has moved back to Thunder Bay, where he now lives with his lovely wife - as well as the majority of his relatives - working as a pharmacist.

When he isn't writing or dispensing medications, Alexander enjoys listening to and playing music, although he does admit that his musical abilities could stand for some improvement. He also spends many a day aboard his bicycle despite the unfortunate design flaws of Thunder Bay's bike paths and bike lanes.

Where does all the money go?

All the money from this campaign will go directly into funding the publication of Lucifer. Specifically, these funds will pay the editors at Iguana Books, cover the costs of cover design, formatting, and layout for print and the eBook, and help market the book when it comes out.

What's the impact of this campaign?

A successful campaign would mean getting my story out there and hopefully promoting discussion around some topics that fascinate me, like the implications inherent in a fatalistic world-view, as well as the natures of gods and the ultimate evil, all the while providing people with an enjoyable read.

Thank you

Thank you for taking the time to stop by and seeing what I have to say. A huge thank you to anyone who contributes, even a small amount - even the smallest donation goes a long way. And, of course, thank you, thank you, thank you to each individual who tells everyone and anyone about the campaign!

Wawa Book Review critically assesses contemporary literature published on the African continent.

For the second quarter of 2016, we are raising funds to buy 29 books and to cover the costs of shipping and internet services:

  1. The Scarecrow by Ibrahim Al-Koni ($18.34)
  2. The Tomb-Builders of the Pharaohs by Morris Bierbrier ($18.34)
  3. Temple Bar by Bahaa Abdelmegid ($18.34)
  4. Red Wine by Amina Zaydan ($18.29)
  5. The Naguib Mahfouz Reader Edited by Denys Johnson-Davies ($18.34)
  6. A Rare Blue Bird Flies with Me by Youssef Fadel ($12.70)
  7. The Televangelist by Ibrahim Essa ($15.52)
  8. Whitefly by Abdelilah Hamdouchi ($11.28)
  9. Affluenza by Niq Mhlongo ($16.43)
  10. The Peculiars by Jen Thorpe ($15.10)
  11. Outside the Lines by Ameera Patel ($13.56)
  12. Little Suns by Zakes Mda ($15.77)
  13. Continental Shift by Kevin Bloom, Richard Poplak ($18.17)
  14. Mongrel by William Dicey ($15.77)
  15. Murder at Small Koppie by Greg Marinovich ($17.17)
  16. To Quote Myself by Khaya Dlanga ($12.36)
  17. Gang Town by Don Pinnock ($15.43)
  18. I Have Time And Other Stories by Franka Maria Andoh ($5.22)
  19. Between Two Worlds by Amma Darko ($9.13)
  20. My Father's Song by Efo Kodjo Mawugbe ($6.52)
  21. Testaments of Seasons by Mawuli Adzei ($5.22)
  22. The Witch of Lagbati by Mawuli Adzei ($5.22)
  23. Prison Graduates by Efo Kodjo Mawugbe ($5.22)
  24. Who Told The Most Incredible Stories? by Naana Jane Opoku-Agyemang ($26.11)
  25. Gold Coast Boy by Kwame Addo-Kufuor ($13.05)

An Introduction to Tango

“Hi! I’m Tango, the Tangeroo. Let me tell you a little about myself and what you can do to help me become a fully engaging interactive animated book app series!  Here’s my story…"

The Tales of TANGO Hardback Books 

Background on Tango the Tangeroo Stories

“The Tales of Tango – The Tangaroo” is a three part series of children’s books that were self-published back in the late 1990’s.  First there was “The Tales of Tango –The Brave Lesson”. The story was located in Australia. The moral lesson was “Don’t be afraid to follow your dreams, no matter how strange or silly they seem! Dreams have a way to talking to you, believe in yourself and make them come true!" This origin story book was brought to the attention of Lady Diana, Princess of Wales as a birthday gift to her two sons, Prince William and Prince Harry. In return, a kind thank you letter followed from her royal highness from Kensington Palace.

[When we hit our goal of $25,000 Children's World Media will make the first "Tales of Tango - The Brave Lesson" an interactive book app.]

The second book was titled, “The Tales of Tango – The Sticky Situation”. The story moved to London, England and the lesson this time was about telling the truth. 

[If we exceed $50,000 in pledges we will make the 2nd Book as an interactive animated book app. Plus Backers at $50 or higher will receive a special gift from Tango.]

The third story was titled, “The Tales of Tango – The Fair of the Pharaohs” which was about traveling to Egypt and being fair and not to discriminate against others. A wonderful quote from this book was, “Green or blue, short or tall, to be fair to one, you must be fair to all. ” Due to lack of funds, this was the last book that was self-published.

[If we exceed $75,000 in pledges we will make the 3rd Book as an interactive animated book app. Plus Backers at $75 or higher will receive a special gift.]

Tango was very popular with children, parents and teachers. From 1996 to 1999, Tango was quite a sensation and children loved his book and live appearances. Tango was featured in the newspapers, television newscasts, appearances at stores and elementary schools.

Why We Want To Make a Tango Interactive Book App

Children's World Media wants to reintroduce the Tales of Tango series to children around the world. Besides the fun of a book app with sound, music, animation and interaction, children will learn valuable life lessons as Tango travels the world. This will bring smiles to children’s faces everywhere when they see and read about Tango’s adventures and influencing their lives in a positive manner.www.ChildrensWorldMedia.com

The Tales of TANGO as an Interactive Animated Book App

We would like to take the initial three books and convert them to fully interactive book apps. This interactive book app will engage the child with Tango and his adventures which could never be done in a standard printed book or pdf file. As an interactive book app the child’s engagement is at a very high level that is fun, educational and enjoyable. The Tango stories were designed for children of all ages.

To make Tango’s dream come true, this interactive book app requires graphic artists, creative animators and a software development team.  This requires funding and we hope to achieve this through fans of Tango and future fans of Tango through Indiegogo.

The Tango series is authored by Sally Atkinson. Sally’s writing comes from combining her love of travel, animals, books and children. The illustrations were done by an award-winning artist, Lee Netzel using delightful watercolor drawings.

If we exceed $100,000 in pledges we will make the 4th Book as an animated book app. Plus Backers at $100 or higher will receive a special gift.

The Future of Tango and His Adventures

Sally’s dream was to write a whole series about Tango the Tangeroo for generations of children. With the launch of these first three interactive book apps, she would then like to write a fourth book titled, “Lost in Machu Picchu” where Tango learns that life’s rewards are not always about trophies and medals. Sally has plans for fifth, sixth and seventh interactive book app for her Tango series where Tango goes to Russia, France and Scotland. But we can only make her dreams come true if you can help Tango become an interactive book app through indiegogo.

Where We Are Currently With The Tango Interactive Book App

We story boarded out the page designs and we are in the process in starting all the animation elements. The story line has been converted and we are getting close to sending it out for a full voice over recording. We have all the printed material and just started the design layout process of the book app.

Jovana Collections is the Product Sponsor to Support Tango the Tangeroo with Unique Gift Rewards for Backers. www.JovanaCollections.com

Backer's $75 Reward: Jovana Collections Heart Earrings - Your choice of Purple, Pink, Peach or Blue. (Width 1" and Length 2")

Backer's $100 to $180 Rewards: Jovana Collections Special Limited Edition Tango Charms and Leather Bracelet. (18cm to 22cm)

 

Backer's $250 Reward: Jovana Collections Tassel Charm Necklaces - Your choice of Orange, Purple, Pink or Blue. (28" to 32" length)

Backer's $500 Reward: Jovana Collections Limited Edition Bracelets - Your choice of Blue, Pink, Orange or Purple. (16.5cm to 24cm)

story:
Who Are We?

nomadic sojourns creative collective (nscc) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that supports the works of emerging and established writers and artists. Through publications (including translations) and performances, nscc aims to build community among artists across disciplines. We also offer intimate events and workshops in our new creative workspace in the Fruitvale district of Oakland, California. 

Past Successes

We have had some amazing successes since 2012, including: groundbreaking publications with renowned projection light artists Thorston Bauer, Candaş Şişman, Tim Noble, and Sue Webster; challenging explorations of desire by Jamieson Webster, Amy Hollywood, and Eric Anthamatten; and stunning poetry and illustrations by our own Michaela Mullin and Mariela Yeregui. 

We have eight publications thus far; this will be our ninth—but only with your help. 

We also publish book, art, event, and film reviews on an array of cutting-edge publications, exhibitions, and moving pictures. 

What We Need

We need $5,000 to do the following three things: 

  1. Design, print, distribute, and promote our third annual journal, nomadic sojourns journal, volume III
  2. Commission two murals within the community of Fruitvale in Oakland, California
  3. Ensure that our small operations in Oakland remain viable

Tax-deductible Donations

ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX DEDUCTIBLE. After you donate, you will receive a receipt in the amount of your donation, which you can then use during tax time to claim your rightful tax deduction for donating to a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. 

What You Get: The Goodies

Depending on the size of your donation, you will receive: 

  • An array of our past and future publications, including our annual journals, chapbooks, and special issues. 
  • The "Human Species: A Personal Dictionary" poster by Andrea Lira.
  • A print of a photograph by Kristen Dill. 
  • A print of an artwork by either Jordan Weber or Mariela Yeregui. 

Our Impact

The nomadic sojourns creative collective supports artists from multiple disciplines (writers, musicians, painters, dancers, animators, projection artists—you name it) to do what they do best: CREATE!

We primarily publish new voices (many people for their first time) and give them the exposure they deserve. 

We want to be the playful medium that brings artists of all walks of life together to collaborate and create beautiful publications and host original performances around Brooklyn, New York, and Oakland, California; around the country; and funding permitting, around the world. 

Our vision is simple and clear: Keep moving and keep making.

But we need your help to keep our operations viable. 

Future Happenings

Next year, 2015, marks a big year for nomadic sojourns creative collective. We have signed a distribution agreement with Small Press Distribution based in Berkeley, California, acquired an amazing new printer based in Winnipeg, Canada, and have books in the works on the Israeli and Palestinian conflict as well as original translations of yet untranslated Chinese authors. 

Until then, let's finish 2014 strong!

Help Us Spread the Message

Please help us spread the message by telling your friends and family members about our campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools to make this campaign's message travel via your social media networks like Facebook and Twitter. 

And remember: All donations are TAX DEDUCTIBLE.

Thank you!

Thank you for your support! Thank you for your donations!

story:
Short Summary

This book is not only going to demonstrate how important true love is, but it shall also discuss how Social Media helped teach me the keys to a deeper more fulfilling love. Each page will be filled with stories of heart ache, pain, and joy as told by men and women in the world of Facebook:

  • My name is Richard O. Rowland, Jr., and I am a writer for Mogul
    Metropolitan Magazine out of Louisville, KY. For the past few years I have
    celebrated marriages and I have also witnessed divorce. In each instance the
    question I asked myself was how does love play in both of those scenarios.
    Because God knows love is the one thing I have been searching for.

  • This manuscript is very important to me because while love is
    something many men and women hope to find: "true love is like ghosts, which
    everyone talks about and few have seen."- Francois de La Rochefoucauld

  • Your contributions will help me give a voice to many Facebook
    Friends who helped me gain a greater understanding of what love is, and how to
    display it to the most important individual person of my life. This will be a
    very interesting read because mixing Social Media and Love is a very delicious
    cocktail one can't begin to sit down. So bottoms up. True love is like ghosts, which everyone talks about and few have seen.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • I need at least $4400 to get the process started: creating an app,
    book cover design, page layout, marketing, LCN #, etc!

  • I have some very exciting perks that I hope you guys will take
    advantage of, such as a special dinner with a friend and me, or even a nice
    time hanging out with me on the Bourbon Trail in Kentucky.

  • If I don’t reach the goal then we will be doing it again until the
    goal is met, in the mean time the money given will be used to fund the project
    and get it started.

The Impact

Men and women alike need help in honing the ancient art of true love. Too many marriages have failed and too many relationships never had the chance to get off the ground. Understanding love is the key to a fulfilled and happy life.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out, email blast it, Tweet it, Facebook it, and tell others to donate 1 dollar or more to my campaign.

story:
Here I am.

I'm Ellyn Touchette, from Portland, Maine.

I'm a first-year Bioengineering student at the University of Maine in Orono and I am a POET. I like roller derby and baby goats.

I've been writing ever since I was literate and attending poetry slams since I was fourteen. At the end of my senior year at Gorham High School, I became Port Veritas' 2012 Youth Slam champion and a member of the first all female state slam team. I am qualified to compete in Port Veritas' upcoming semi-final slam for a spot on their nationally recognized 2013 slam team. In November, I released my first chapbook, Dead Was the Machine God, at Rhythmic Cypher in Portland. This year I will be releasing my first album, a recorded version of my book with musical backing, recorded and mastered by Luk O'Connor of Portland.

For years, I've aspired to take my poetry to greater audiences, with a general goal of altering the way people view the world around them. Ever since I became aware of the existence of the Women of the World Poetry Slam (WOWPS), it became one of my greatest goals in life to attend as a competitor, not only to share my work, but to meet and learn from several of the greatest inspirations in my life and to my writing.

I am proud and honored to announce that I will be representing Port Veritas' Second Tuesday Slam, Portland, Maine, at the Women of the World Poetry Slam in Minneapolis, Minnesota this March 6-10. However, I am a full time college student... This is where you come in.

$500, you say?

WOWPS takes place in Minneapolis, close to 1500 miles from my home. Funding this journey as a student is a massive financial challenge, and any help would be greatly appreciated. I have my aforementioned chapbook, which I'd be happy to send to anyone who helps me get to this once-a-year internationally recognized event. There are also two other options of perks for your contributions listed to the right. 

$500 will cover my plane ticket and my hotel room. Anything above and beyond will help with food, travel around Minneapolis, the printing of more chapbooks, and the inevitable sudden unexpected expenses during travel that no one foresees... but always happen.

Thank you all so very, very much. I'll see you at WOWPS!

Love,

Ellyn Touchette

story:
Hi All,

I’m delighted to announce the upcoming launch of my first self-published cookbook, When Bakers Cook.


What's When Bakers Cook about?
In addition to great baking, I've also created some wonderful cooking recipes over the years via my food features for the New York Times, Washington Post, Bon Appetit, Food and Wine et al, and of course, for my popular website, www.BetterBaking.com.

Now it's time to take the best of my best and wrap it up in a gorgeous print cookbook. Rather than offer a recipe here and there online, I want to share a total cooking experience with you – the one that comes with the joy of holding a one-of-kind cookbook in your hands. When Bakers Cook is destined to become an well-used, grease-stained beloved book, the foundation of many great meals for family and friends.

What sort of recipes will you find in this cookbook?

Over 175 of my best recipes! When Bakers Cook has only the best recipes from Breakfast (Red Velvet Waffles with Cream Cheese Drizzle, Drive-Thru Breakfast Sandwiches) and the world's most sensational Soups (Carrot Coriander, Bistro Squash Soup, and Pub Style Onion Soup au Gratin) to Chicken (Portugese Grilled Chicken, Morroccan Spice Chicken and Lemon Garlic Chicken), Beef (Guinness Beef Stew, Bistro Pepper Steak) and Sides, Salads, Desserts (Deluxe Banana Cream Pie, Diner Style Baked Apples). I’ve even included a bonus Baking chapter (Salted Caramel Cheesecake, Greek Yogurt  Blueberry Muffins and Carrot Cake Biscotti). Each recipe in this wonderful collection is simple, tasty, and at once trendy and classic.

It all makes for a very special cookbook that will become a new classic. This is a black and white cookbook, in the tradition of Silver Palate and Moosewood, cookbooks that are still revered and used by a few generations. I like to think of When Bakers Cook as a Joy of Cooking for the new millennium - it's everything you need and want in a cookbook but with a style and taste like no other cookbook. It's for new cooks and pros, filled not only with great recipes but the best of my tricks and trade secrets as a chef.

Why Self-Publish?
Traditional publishing is changing and instead of focusing on great food and timeless recipes, celebrity and social media reign supreme. Alternatively, many cookbooks are also one-subject ones, showcasing the trends of the day. The celebrity cookbooks and TV shows also lack the warmth of a chef who has not only created her recipes for her readers, family and friends but is uniquely connected to her audience. To this end, there hasn't been such a comprehensive, one-voice, go-to cookbook on the market for the longest time; a cookbook that features contemporary classic and tasty recipes that are both easy to prepare and broadly appealing.

What will the money be used for?
Cash is needed to pay the copy editors, proof-readers, indexers, photographers, graphic designers, and publishing formatters for both print and digital production. Funds are also needed to underwrite printing costs retail distribution fees. This cookbook also necessitates re-design and re-launching my website, www.BetterBaking.com so that it is mechanically sound to support my cookbook efforts through e-commerce and promotion.

When Bakers Cook is all but ready to roll: the recipes have triple-tested (thanks to a wonderful volunteer test team) and the manuscript is written. As it heads into production, its official book launch and will be for sale,  I’m calling upon my amazing community of subscribers to help me finance a publishing team and get this wonderful book out to the market.

With love from my kitchen to yours, here's cooking at you!

Marcy Goldman


About Marcy Goldman and www.BetterBaking.com

Launched in 1997 by master baker and author Marcy Goldman, BetterBaking.com includes over 2500 original recipes that been featured in publications such as the Washington Post, New York Times, Bon Appetit, and on Martha Stewart Radio.
story_txt:
Hi All,
I’m delighted to announce the upcoming launch of my first self-published cookbook, When Bakers Cook.
What's When Bakers Cook about?In addition to great baking, I've also created some wonderful cooking recipes over the years via my food features for the New York Times, Washington Post, Bon Appetit, Food and Wine et al, and of course, for my popular website, www.BetterBaking.com. Now it's time to take the best of my best and wrap it up in a gorgeous print cookbook. Rather than offer a recipe here and there online, I want to share a total cooking experience with you – the one that comes with the joy of holding a one-of-kind cookbook in your hands. When Bakers Cook is destined to become an well-used, grease-stained beloved book, the foundation of many great meals for family and friends.
What sort of recipes will you find in this cookbook?Over 175 of my best recipes! When Bakers Cook has only the best recipes from Breakfast (Red Velvet Waffles with Cream Cheese Drizzle, Drive-Thru Breakfast Sandwiches) and the world's most sensational Soups (Carrot Coriander, Bistro Squash Soup, and Pub Style Onion Soup au Gratin) to Chicken (Portugese Grilled Chicken, Morroccan Spice Chicken and Lemon Garlic Chicken), Beef (Guinness Beef Stew, Bistro Pepper Steak) and Sides, Salads, Desserts (Deluxe Banana Cream Pie, Diner Style Baked Apples). I’ve even included a bonus Baking chapter (Salted Caramel Cheesecake, Greek Yogurt  Blueberry Muffins and Carrot Cake Biscotti). Each recipe in this wonderful collection is simple, tasty, and at once trendy and classic.It all makes for a very special cookbook that will become a new classic. This is a black and white cookbook, in the tradition of Silver Palate and Moosewood, cookbooks that are still revered and used by a few generations. I like to think of When Bakers Cook as a Joy of Cooking for the new millennium - it's everything you need and want in a cookbook but with a style and taste like no other cookbook. It's for new cooks and pros, filled not only with great recipes but the best of my tricks and trade secrets as a chef. 
Why Self-Publish?Traditional publishing is changing and instead of focusing on great food and timeless recipes, celebrity and social media reign supreme. Alternatively, many cookbooks are also one-subject ones, showcasing the trends of the day. The celebrity cookbooks and TV shows also lack the warmth of a chef who has not only created her recipes for her readers, family and friends but is uniquely connected to her audience. To this end, there hasn't been such a comprehensive, one-voice, go-to cookbook on the market for the longest time; a cookbook that features contemporary classic and tasty recipes that are both easy to prepare and broadly appealing.
What will the money be used for?Cash is needed to pay the copy editors, proof-readers, indexers, photographers, graphic designers, and publishing formatters for both print and digital production. story:
Help Us Light Local Authors On Fire!

FUND

100 Small Fires to Make Your Book Sales BLAZE, Book Launch & Virtual Tour

ABOUT THIS PROJECT

100 Small Fires to Make Your Book Sales Blaze is a “how-to” book for authors with creative marketing strategies and tips designed to increase book sales. The book is in the final stages of editing, and will be published by the authors no later than November 19th 2012. For the three months following our book’s birthday, we will conduct a Light Local Authors on Fire! Virtual Book Tour. The tour is meant to help new authors or authors with limited budgets build awareness and consideration for their books. We are committed to helping talented authors emerge from obscurity. You can read more about 100 Small Fires To Make Your Book Sales Blaze at www.100SmallFires.com.

Who we are.

Sisters, TK Read and Kathleen Vrona, are successful entrepreneurs and have collaborated on a variety of projects including multiple Internet projects in the 1990’s. As early Internet pioneers, TK launched gama.com, the first on-line mediation site, and Kathleen founded one of the first Internet Service Providers in the Chicago Il area. In addition to launching new companies and services, TK has spent the last seven years working on middle grade and young adult science fiction and fantasy novels.  You can read more about her at www.tkread.com. Kathleen, in the meantime, has been developing creative marketing strategies for Fortune 100 companies while writing in her spare time.


Where will the money go?

The $3500.00 will go to production, publication, marketing, contest and prize giveaways. Right now we plan on a three month Light Local Authors on Fire Virtual Tour, with contests, marketing tips and giveaways for each locality. Should we exceed budget we will increase giveaways, and add some physical tour stops to complement our virtual tours.

What will happen if we don’t meet budget?

Should we fail to meet budget, we will still publish an Ebook, however we will not be able to publish a print version or do the virtual tours.

story:
Short Summary

Blacktop Passages is a Literary Review focused on publishing the best stories, poetry and non-fiction centering on the road. When we say the road, we mean it and everything encompassing it. From travel to gas station. We embrace everything that connects to and connects us to the road.

We've started an Indie GoGo campaign as our work is completely voluntary and being an independent journal with intentions to print, this can difficult; we're not working within a university system, nor are we receiving government funding--so far everything accomplished from construction of the website, to the domain, to all things beauracratic (such as the road to requesting an ISSN) is money out of the four editors' pockets. Three of the editors are students in graduate MFA programs and one is a graduated author of a soon-to-be two novels, working hard at both Blacktop Passages and a Haitan magazine as well. We all work to the bone and spill money from our pocket to upkeep a goal we see as giving back. Giving back to the road which inspires all of us and  giving back to the writing community.

Our intention is to offer our journal completely FREE. If even when someone requests a copy over the Internet, we don't want to charge them for shipping. With your contribution you can help us keep that ideal.

Our distribution plan is really the most intensive and interesting: We want to watch Blacktop Passages spread across the roadways and interstates. We plan on distributing them at travel stops, rest areas and truck centers with a proposal that the recipient of the issue read it, enjoy it, pass it on and maybe even Tweet it.

Here it is broken down:

You're on a road trip and stop at a rest area somewhere outside of Chicago. There's a copy of Blacktop Passages sitting on a picnic table. You pick it up, get back in the car and read it on the road. Once you're finished with it and you've throughly enjoyed it, you can surely hang on to it if you want, or you can "pass it on." Just leave it at the next reast area, somewhere halfway to Arizona. Take a picture of it and Tweet it @ us. People can try and find a copy if one has crossed a local travel stop, or simply watch where one starts and where it ends up.

What We Need & What You Get

We've set our goal to $3000. This ensures we'll manage a large print run and be able to upkeep the basic operations of our organization and future issues. We know this seems like a high amount, but what it will do for us is more than you could realize. It keeps us thriving as a print journal, existing for at the very least several more years, with less worry of printing and distribution costs.

We dont have much to offer, but what we can offer we can offer lots of... which is our signatures, the print issue when it's released and other cool things like that. We hope you enjoy what we do offer. If you don't, let us know. We'll see if we can persuade you with other prizes... if we have other prizes.

If we don't reach our entire goal, that's okay. Any amount is helpful really. We're still going to do a print run--though it may be smaller--it will not go undone. We are a passionate group of writers & editors and will accomplish what we set out to do come Hell or high water. But you can really help us. Even if it's just a few bucks.

The Impact

Printed publications are becoming less and less these days. The literary publications that do still exist in printed form are becoming more and more expensive as time goes on, print costs go up and less people buy them.

We are doing exactly what those on the Books-A-Million shelf are doing... only for FREE. We believe good writing, should be honored and spread around. Given a proper presentation and bestowed upon the world. It shouldn't cost out your ear for it either.

We also strive to advance and innovate the distribution, consumption and interactivity of literature. With Blacktop Passages, you're not only enjoying great writing, but you're also participating in a nationwide adventure--something along the lines of WheresGeorge.com or BookCrossing.com. We want great work to spread and it only seems fitting that it happens on a setting like the road, where many are in transition and constantly looking for things to keep their minds fresh.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't spare any money. We totally understand. You could help us spread the word though! Re-Tweet or Tweet @ us; show your support. Add us on Facebook or Tumblr. Tell all your friends about us, especially the ones who are writers. Go to your local library or university and post our flyers around the buildings! Whatever you can do is a GREAT help to us!

 

WWW.BLACKTOPPASSAGES.COM

@BlaktopPassages

BLACKTOPPASSAGES.TUMBLR.COM

www.facebook.com/blacktop.passages

story:
Ahoy! My name is Andrew Tickell, but most of you will know me as the Lallands Peat Worrier. By day, I research and teach public law and human rights; by night, I don a frock coat, a Marie-Antoinette wig, and blog excitedly on the latest developments in Scottish law and politics.

I could do with a hand.

2014 is a big year and the last three months of the independence referendum campaign promises to be an critical and exciting time.  I love writing. I haven't yet found a way to make it pay to any remotely sustaining extent, but few pleasures compare to firing up the blog and unleashing a thought or two in print about the affairs of the day. Those pleasures have been heightened by the independence referendum, and the profusion of stuff to be thought and scribbled about, but the pressures of other duties and concerns have to a great extent limited the time I can judiciously commit to it.

I've particularly enjoyed the opportunity to try my hand at a different sort of writing in the latest two editions of the Drouth, the first being an account of aNational Collective meet up, the second a surreal conversation with a lushed-up Old Soldier about the positive case for the Union. It'd be splendid to be able to do more. 

Term is over, the doctorate is essentially done and dusted, and I'm in the market for more permanent, remunerative work. This is, as countless other folk have experienced, a joyless, harrowing endeavour punctuated mainly by setbacks and failures, but I'm not downhearted.  I am, however, at a loose end and must try to keep body and soul together somehow over the next few months. 

My first order preference would be to be able to use the time to give the #indyref the attention it deserves, and to be able to write more considered, Drouth-style pieces for the blog about how the campaign is unfolding and being experienced. The conversation in the media has become so unrepresentatively shrill, that I'd like to expand the sort of discussions Michael Greenwell, our guests and I have been having to include more folk who disagree with us on the constitution, exploring some of the ambivalences of both sides of the debate which the aggressive binary vision of the referendum consistently elides and suppresses. 

This was one of the charms, for me, of Derek Bateman's recent return to the microphone. As a first stab in this direction, I'm hoping to record a discussion with arch unionist professor, Adam Tomkins, over the next few weeks, with respectful but not unchallenging dialogue being the watchword. People do politics better in this country than the ongoing stramash portrays. We should all do our best to reflect that much more civilised and thoughtful reality.

Which is where you come in, or can come in, if this vision appeals to you. As it stands, it doesn't look like I'll be able to afford to take that time away to do the referendum justice. This is bad timing, but it's as simple as that. I am not, however, a man of great needs and wants and have tried to work out the minimum extra income I'd need, to make it possible to supercharge the blog over the last three months of the campaign, instead of offering only a skeleton service and the very occasional comment piece.

By my reckoning, it is about £750 to £1,000: not an insignificant sum of money, but the least required to keep the show consistently on the road. So that's what I'm pitching for. What's to lose? If you value the occasionally oddball, but independent and open-minded legal and political commentary I've undertaken here since 2009, I'd very much appreciate your support at this key time in Scottish politics. 

As the journalists rightly reminds us, if you want to invest in quality journalism, buy a paper. The same goes for quality blogging. There is something a bit mortifying about this -- but I'll choke it down. Fear of failure is remarkably debilitating. If you've enjoyed my work on the blog, and would like to see much more of it over the final push towards the referendum, making the case for independence and rooting out some of those overlooked Scotlands fizzing away in this campaign, whatever your views on the constitution, I'd very much appreciate any contribution you might feel moved to make. If not, I'll see you over the pint I'll be pulling.

story:
Introduction to Project

Blessings to All,

My name is Elena Vasilenka. I am a Naam Yoga teacher, Harmonium Healing practitioner, Holisitc Health coach and a creator of the "Naam Yoga Therapies for Happiness" DVD program. This program helps people to deal with mental and emtional issues in a holisic way through the use of breathwork and mantra meditation. To learn more about Naam Yoga and my work please visit www.elenavasilenka.com, www.naamyoga.com, and www.naamscience.com.

For my next project, I ask your support to create my book called: 

"Welcome to the Happyness Hotel"

This book will contain tools, practices, and knowledge that I collected and used during my 10 year research on how to heal my own depression, OCD, eating disorder, and other  emotional challenges. It will help people to find their path for happiness, lowering stress, reducing anxiety and to feel better naturally through the healing power of Naam Yoga Therapies, nutrition, and latest scientific research in the science of happiness and mental health. 

My friend...the talented, brilliant, and 9 times Tony Award winning Broadway legend TOMMY TUNE has kindly agreed to donate his time and to personally illustrate the book!

http://www.tommytune.com

 

Project Goals:

I need to raise $5000 to launch this book.  Funds are for creating and printing of book.  A portion will be for PR/Marketing.

 

Contributions:

Many blessings from us for your support!  See what you get for your contribution in the Perks section!!!

Spread the word:

Please share our project with your friends! 

Bless you and thank you so much for your help and support! 

With Love, Peace and Light~  

Elena and "Welcome to the Happyness Hotel" team.

story:
Going to Big Sur to Hone Our Craft

Hi! We're Salima Alikhan and Steph Pellegrin, and we live in the kidlit haven of Austin, Texas, where we're surrounded by the creativity and support of our authorly community. We're both passionate and dedicated writers of children's fiction, and are very conscious of the need to tell truthful and diverse stories. We both write stories in which characters grapple with the kinds of things that accurately reflect children's lives: family dynamics, racial diversity, abuse, mental illness, finding one's place among obstacles big and small (and there are happy bits in our books, too -- we swears it on the Precious!) Sometimes these issues are dealt with via magic and sometimes via contemporary realism, but it's our belief that it's always important to write in a truthful and compassionate way.
We're always looking for opportunities to hone and deepen our craft. We've salivated over the idea of attending the Big Sur Writing Workshop for years, and this year, we decided to try to make it a reality. 
We're hoping to make it to Big Sur next March, where we'd get to work closely with talented industry professionals. It would be an amazing opportunity to get a number of skillful eyes on our work and to get wonderful, in-depth feedback. 
Your contribution would allow us to realize this dream.
Where Your Contributions are Going
The cost of the Big Sur Writing workshop is about $800 per person. We'll also need to buy airfare and get a rental car, which we're estimating at about $500 per person. We're asking for $2900 to cover workshop, travel, and tax expenses (any Indiegogo earnings are considered taxable income, so we'll be paying taxes on those, too, as well as paying Indiegogo their cut.) 

We Have Awesome Rewards for You!

Our fantabulous rewards include:
-postcards
-art prints by Salima
-three-dimensional book art by Stephanie
-Skype author visits
-critiques of up to 50 pages of your WIP 
-getting a character named after you in one of our books
Some Ways You Can Pitch In Even If You Can't Donate
Even if a monetary donation isn't in the cards for you right now, there are a number of ways you can help us! You can share our video on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, any social media platform with which you're comfortable! Any shout-outs are much, much appreciated. Indiegogo makes sharing easy--you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank You So Much For Your Time and Contribution!! 

If you'd like to read more about either of us, our websites can be found here: 
www.salimaalikhan.net
www.stephaniepellegrin.com

We both write stories in which characters grapple with the kinds of things that accurately reflect children's lives: family dynamics, racial diversity, abuse, mental illness, finding one's place among obstacles big and small (and there are happy bits in our books, too -- we swears it on the Precious!) Sometimes these issues are dealt with via magic and sometimes via contemporary realism, but it's our belief that it's always important to write in a truthful and compassionate way.
We're always looking for opportunities to hone and deepen our craft. We've salivated over the idea of attending the Big Sur Writing Workshop for years, and this year, we decided to try to make it a reality. 

We're hoping to make it to Big Sur next March, where we'd get to work closely with talented industry professionals. It would be an amazing opportunity to get a number of skillful eyes on our work and to get wonderful, in-depth feedback. 
Your contribution would allow us to realize this dream.

Where Your Contributions are Going

The cost of the Big Sur Writing workshop is about $800 per person. We'll also need to buy airfare and get a rental car, which we're estimating at about $500 per person. We're asking for $2900 to cover workshop, travel, and tax expenses (any Indiegogo earnings are considered taxable income, so we'll be paying taxes on those, too, as well as paying Indiegogo their cut.) 
   We Have Awesome Rewards for You!

Our fantabulous rewards include:
-postcards
-art prints by Salima
-three-dimensional book art by Stephanie
-Skype author visits
-critiques of up to 50 pages of your WIP 
-getting a character named after you in one of our books
Some Ways You Can Pitch In Even If You Can't Donate
Even if a monetary donation isn't in the cards for you right now, there are a number of ways you can help us! You can share our video on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, any social media platform with which you're comfortable! Any shout-outs are much, much appreciated. Indiegogo makes sharing easy--you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

    Thank You So Much For Your Time and Contribution!! 
If you'd like to read more about either of us, our websites can be found here: www.salimaalikhan.net
www.stephaniepellegrin.com

story:
Featuring interviews and insights from leading journalists, commentators, experts and thinkers, this book will offer a compelling and well-researched case for the renewal of a vital component in Scotland's national life.

Scotland is a country of diverse economies, varied landscapes, distinct cultures and big ideas. As the past year has shown us, our politics can grab the attention of global audiences and move millions. 

At the same time there is widespread anger and distrust throughout the country about the conduct of newspapers and broadcasters as a result of their coverage of the referendum. It's time to channel that strength of feeling into a compelling set of demands for change. But this question goes beyond politics and our own borders: the rapidly declining resources available for quality journalism, diverse opinion and innovative programming in Scotland should be a matter of concern for all. 

Christopher Silver has written extensively about Scotland's media: 

http://nationalcollective.com/2014/12/13/its-time-to-question-a-declining-media/

http://bellacaledonia.org.uk/2014/07/16/towards-a-21st-century-broadcaster

http://newsnet.scot/2013/10/nothing-interesting-here-changing-scotlands-media-desert/

https://www.opendemocracy.net/ourkingdom/christopher-silver/in-search-of-scottish-summer

He produced a feature length documentary on Scottish independence, Scotland Yet, edited a collection of art and writing, Inspired by Independence and has contributed writing to numerous websites and publications. 

What You Get

If fully funded, this project can deliver the following:

    • A compelling and succinct analysis of an unfolding crisis and its potentially vast impact on Scottish democracy. 
    • Thorough research and inquiry into international models to explore alternative visions of Scotland's media future (s). 
    • A series of podcasts, featuring interview highlights, made available for free online as the book is being produced. 
    • Both print and e-book versions. 
    • Discussion events throughout Scotland in the early summer to keep the conversation going.

The Impact
This project aims to kick start a wide-ranging conversation about the media Scotland wants and the media Scotland needs. With BBC charter renewal set for 2016 and rapidly unfolding political events offering opportunities for Scotland to demand structural change, it will address issues of acute topical relevance. 
Working with organisations throughout Scotland, this book will be made widely available at an affordable price and will aim to play an important role in turning outrage at the failings of our media into concrete demands for action.

Funding

I'm delighted to be working with Word Power Books on this project. As a publisher of high quality work on Scottish politics, including the highly successful Unstated: Writers on Scottish Independence, they're ideally placed to publish this book. Their involvement also guarantees that the book will be printed in Scotland .
The money raised on this page will cover the costs of research, travel, writing, podcast production and design.

story:
About Kicking Corporate Booty

We are in a political moment where things are rapidly changing.  The Occupy movement has opened up new possibilities and made millions of people believe that another world is possible. There is a growing consciousness that we, as a society, need a new value system rooted in practices and structures of liberation. To create this new world, we will need to take on the corporations who are destroying our planet, devastating our communities, keeping us in debt, and profiting from it all. Kicking Corporate Booty will be a manual to help you do just that. 

Kicking Corporate Booty is a flexible model of strategic organizing that empowers ordinary people to take on corporations and win. I have been working with and evolving this model for over twenty years; winning victories with low-wage workers, anti-nuclear youth activists, DREAM activists, foreclosed homeowners, and others fighting for justice. 

Now it’s time for me to take what I’ve learned and make these ideas widely accessible by publishing the Kicking Corporate Booty Manual. This Manual will lay out strategies, principles, and tools to permeate the collective consciousness with your issue, focus on clear targets, and build to a period of compression and crisis to win your campaign while building a culture of liberation.

The Manual will also have a companion website with downloadable resources, case studies, and a searchable database of key corporate players, a map-maker, and a forum to share resources and data.

What the funding is for

  • Archiving and preserving original campaign materials
  • Building and designing the companion website, including the corporate database, interactive forum, and downloadable resources
  • Costs associated with writing and editing
  • Graphic design and illustration for the cover art and book layout, as well as designing the charts and resources so they are easy to reproduce and use online and offline

Other ways to help

If you believe in the value of this work, please make a donation. Even $5 or $10 will help make this material widely accessible. 

Please spread the word about this project to your networks. 

For more information about me and my work, and to find resources,visit OrganizingForPower.org

story:
Hooray! We did it!
Thanks to all you amazing supporters, we've reached the goal of our Community Publishing Campaign.

 

Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! Happy Dances are happening around here. We're celebrating, cheering, and beaming with gratitude for all of your wonderful, generous, golden dandelion hearts. We'll be extending the campaign through the holidays so any of our eleventh hour and last minute readers can pick up their copy of the new novel.  (Yes, we know who you are. We love you, too.) Enjoy Winds of Change! - Rivera

 

Calling All Dandelions! It's time to publish
Winds of Change!

 

Resistance, Resilience, Revolution: Winds of Change is here. This is the story you've all been waiting for; the visionary and extraordinary third part of the Dandelion Trilogy. Give big, give bold, give like a dandelion. Together, let's make this Community Publishing Campaign a roaring success and send this story soaring on the Winds of Change!

 

What You Get: Be part of this plucky, dandelion-style Community Publishing Campaign. You can get the brand new very limited - numbered and signed - special edition of the trilogy, unique gifts, handmade art from Rivera Sun, and a chance to say, "I helped launch these novels into the world". And you get to be the first to read Winds of Change.

 

A People-Powered Novel Series

The Dandelion Insurrection is here . . . because of YOU!

 

Seven years ago, we came together to launch an unknown golden yellow novel into the world. Since then, thousands of readers have read these books. They've been taught in university resistance courses, read in tree-sits and at activist blockades, and passed hand-to-hand from one person to another. Thanks to you, the Dandelion Trilogy remains a people-powered novel series, made possible by people like you.

 

Be part of the publishing campaign for Winds of Change!

 

Community Publishing is powerful. The Dandelion Insurrection, The Roots of Resistance, and now Winds of Change are groundbreaking books published by a community of readers (not a giant corporation). We've never been reviewed by the major journals. We've always been a truly indie phenomenon. It's our readers who have spread the word and sent the seeds of the Dandelion Trilogy flying far and wide. The Community Publishing Campaign is a celebration of both the novels and the community of readers who have supported the Dandelion Trilogy over these seven years.  Thank you!

 

Your support of this publishing campaign helps launch Winds of Change into a world that is longing for a story like this - a story of resistance and resilience . . . and revolution.

 

About Winds of Change:

Who's afraid of democracy? The Dandelion Insurrection is about to find out.

 

Winds of Change is a story like no other, a tale of resistance and resilience, hopeful and eerie all at once. With the planet in peril and people struggling to survive, it's all hands on deck for the dandelions. Zadie Byrd Gray wants democracy. Real democracy, not voting for smiling liars every few years. Charlie Rider writes up a storm of inspiration and controversy as he circulates the emergent stories of people-powered democracy. The two party duopoly fights back with a vengeance. The rich plot to thwart them. The living Earth rises up for justice. The debts of the past come due. Teens and elders alike rebel for life and the future. When a megachurch preacher launches a doomsday mission to stop them, the Dandelion Insurrection faces a choice that threatens everything they stand for.

 

With courage and love, the Dandelion Insurrection must act swiftly, for the clock is ticking . . . and the Winds of Change are blowing!

 

Support the Community Publishing Campaign:
Get a book (or two, or ten),
then SHARE on social media so friends far and wide
also have this chance to be a part of the fun!
Thank you.

 

What a wild adventure this has been!

 

The Dandelion Insurrection was my first novel to be launched into the world with a Community Publishing Campaign. Since that moment, I haven't looked back. The circle of support from Community Publishers like you has made it possible for The Dandelion Insurrection and The Roots of Resistance to be put into students' hands and read on the front lines of resistance struggles. They've lifted hearts. They've opened minds. They've moved people into nonviolent action. All this happened because of readers like you. This seven-year journey has been extraordinary . . . and it's only just beginning.

 

Now, it's time to launch the third part of the Dandelion Trilogy: Winds of Change.

 

This is an incredible novel to publish at this precise - and strange - moment of human history. It's prescient and solutionary. Climate, democracy, disaster relief, vision, evolution, compassion, change . . . this story is woven of familiar themes and unexpected solutions. With your help, we'll cover the publishing costs and send this novel far and wide into a world where resistance and resilience are required.

 

I'm asking you to give boldly and generously. This has been a year of upheaval and immense challenge. Your support now goes a long way to helping this novel - and the whole trilogy - make a big splash. Our world is hungry for this story. You can help them find it.

 

In gratitude for your support, I've crafted extra-special thank you gifts (perks). Most are true collector's items - handmade, unique offerings that will never be offered anywhere else.  As I made them, sitting by the hearth while the snow flew past the earthship windows, I thought of all the ways readers like you have kindled a light in the darkness. You've brought hope to people in the midst of despair. You've given young organizers tools for making change. You've moved people of all ages to tears through the power of a story. A novel is made through the love of people like you. It is more than words on paper; it is the way it comes to life in our actions in the world.

 

Thank you for being with me every step of the way . . . or, if you're new, joining into my wild and extraordinary circle of Community Publishers. It is an honor to have your support. I truly couldn't do it without you.

 

With love (and revolution),

Rivera

 

About the Perks

(Here are some of the beautiful new thank-you offerings included in the various perk levels. Click on each perk level to find out what's included in each one.)

 

Winds of Change: The third, extraordinary part of the Dandelion Trilogy is here. A wild tale of resistance and resilience . . . and revolution for people-powered democracy. Get your copy today.

 

Dandelion Trilogy Author's Edition: Extremely limited editions. Only 125 numbered and signed copies will ever be printed. These are true collector's items and NOW is the time to get them. With hand-drawn covers by Rivera Sun (in the style of her original artwork for The Dandelion Insurrection), her signature handwriting woven into the design, and new Author's Notes reflecting on the seven-year-journey of these books, this trilogy edition is a rare and special release!

 

Hell No! We Won't Mow! This short story was released with the original Community Publishing campaign for The Dandelion Insurrection. Now, it's back for a short press run for Winds of Change.

 

Supernova of a Heart Poetry Chapbook: In this chapbook of twenty-seven poems, Rivera Sun unveils her journey through pandemics and uprisings, fires and hurricanes, and the unfaltering terrain of the heart.

 

Skylandia Calendar 2021: Art by Rivera Sun, writings by her sister, Leah Cook. This beautiful, SM.ART (small art) calendar captures the wild beauty of a year on a small farm where the wilds interweave with the farmlands.

 

Be Kind, Be Connected, Be Unafraid Banners: Handmade by Rivera Sun, these banners will brighten any wall and boldly remind the hearts of protesters and neighbors alike that love conquers all.

 

Dandelion Umbrellas & Whistles: You'll know why we made these when you get to Chapter 33 of Winds of Change. Bwahaha!

 

Author Talks & Book Club Visits: Rivera Sun will join your group via Zoom to talk about the book, resistance and resilience, and the power of stories in navigating these times.

 

Give Big. Give Bold.

Give Like The Dandelions!

 

Spread the word. Tell your friends. 

The third part of the Dandelion Insurrection is here ...

and the Winds of Change are blowing!

story:
[Photo: Gaza Strip, 2002, G. Harms]

About Gregory

Gregory Harms is an independent scholar specializing in US foreign policy and the Middle East. He has written three books, including The Palestine-Israel Conflict: A Basic Introduction (2012), now in its third edition, and It's Not about Religion (2012), published by actor/activist Viggo Mortensen's Perceval Press. He also lectures and has written articles for CounterPunch, Juan Cole's Informed Comment, Truthout, and Mondoweiss. His blog is located on Facebook and Blogger.

www.gregoryharms.com

facebook.com/gregoryharms


Reason for fundraising

Gregory is planning to return to the Middle East and is seeking support in this endeavor. The purpose of the trip is to continue his research, write from the region, as well as keep current with present developments.

Funds raised on Indiegogo will help with:

  • airfare
  • immunizations
  • travel insurance
  • lodging (hostels)
  • local travel

Note: Because the money raised will cover the bulk of the trip's expenses, the funding type here is all-or-nothing, or "fixed." This means if the goal ($3,000) isn't met, your money will be fully refunded.

Even a $1 donation will help get Gregory closer to his objective. We hope you'll consider it.

story:
Who are we?

Daring Woman is a social impact organization that harnesses the power of media to help women find their voice and become unstoppable. 

Daring Woman was created in December 2017 by Tracey Osborne as a social impact organization that harnesses the power of media to help women find their voice and become unstoppable. 

Tracey is a rape and domestic abuse survivor and she is on a mission to empower women on a global scale. No longer a silent victim, Tracey is using her voice to make an impact and encourage others to do the same.

At Daring Woman, we are a community of action-takers and we are not afraid to step out of our comfort zone. We cheer each other on and lend a hand when someone is down. We laugh together and we cry together. We celebrate what it means to be a woman and our confidence is contagious.

We will use funds from our crowdsourcing campaign to fund the growth of our new magazine, Today's Daring Woman. This exciting new magazine is all about Courage. We are different because we are not afraid to stand up and speak our mind. We don't coddle and we don't promote victimhood. We are about getting off your butt and gettin' the job done!

Everyone has struggle and challenge in their lives, but if we stand together, share our stories, and support one another, we can help all women find their courage and speak their voice. 

Join us as we launch the newest women's empowerment magazine - Today's Daring Woman. 

We are Bold. We are Daring. We are Unstoppable. 

How will we use the funding?

  • Our initial funding goal of $5,000 will be used to fund costs associated with the successful launch of Today's Daring Woman magazine
  • We will launch additional crowdfunding campaigns to assist with the other projects described in Tracey's video, including The Daring Woman Project and The Daring Woman Conference
  • Costs will including funding part-time staff to assist with Daring Woman's social media program, magazine layout and editing and miscellaneous marketing campaigns
  • Costs to pay for content contributors
  • Costs associatd with rewards fullfillment 
  • Indiegogo fees and applicable taxes

Daring Woman Goals:

  • The first and most important goal is to have a successful Indiegogo program so that we can continue to grow our business
  • After we successfully launch Today's Daring Woman magazine, we will focus on two key initiatives including The Daring Woman Conference and The Daring Woman Project
  • The Daring Woman Conference titled "Dare to Dream" is expected to launch in 2019 with a two-day event focused on women's empowerment and relationship building. We will launch a new and separate crowdfunding campaign in the future for this project. Watch for more details as it promises to be a very powerful event.
  • The Daring Woman Project is a the non-profit side of our business whose mission is to provide a safe haven for women to gather and share their stories of inspiration, heartache, love, wisdom and expeirence with others. Our goal is to provide shelter for woman who have experienced rape, domestic abuse and/or homelessness. Our community will be a place where women can come and get advice, knowledge and the guidance they need to become the Daring Woman they were born to be!  Watch for more details, coming soon!

Risks and Challenges:

We are a startup organization. We bootstrap everything and with a very small staff, we are the worker bees (no high paid consultants here). We are not afraid to roll up our sleeves and pitch in to get things done. 

But, as with any new startup, there are growing pains and cashflow challenges that can sometimes delay projects. We have planned for this crowdfunding campaign for a long time, so we are confident that the time is right. 

The inaugural issue of Today's Daring Woman magazine is already at the layout/planning stages and we expect to publish our first issue in late August/early September. Thereafter, the magazine expects to publish on a monthly basis, but if cashflow becomes a problem, we may readdress the timing and roll to a bi-monthly magazine until growth generates sufficient cash to accomodoate a monthly publishing schedule. 

But, the good news is, we are a hardworking, driven stafff and we have every expectation that we will meet our stated goals.

We look forward to partnering with you on this endeavor.  Be Bold. Be Daring. Be Unstoppable.

story:
FIST (Fight Imperialism – Stand Together) is a national group of young revolutionaries committed to fighting racism, sexism, oppression of lesbian, gay, bi and trans people, and the exploitation of the working class, all of which result from imperialism and capitalism. We believe that the only way to achieve true liberation for all peoples throughout the world is through unified struggle for socialism.

FIST at the 2013 World Festival of Youth and Students in Quito, Ecuador
Red Flag is the official voice of FIST.  Call us traditionalists, but we believe in reaching out to the people in print. 

FIST activists have traveled to Cuba, Venezuela, Syria, Ferguson, MO, and beyond, building connections with revolutionary youth across the world. We believe these lessons must be passed on to a new generation. What better way to do this than through a magazine of revolutionary theory and practice.

Last year our website reached out to tens of thousands of young people in over 100 countries across the world. This year, we hope thousands of youth will read our magazine and engage in our message of socialist revolution and liberation for oppressed peoples.

 With eyewitness accounts of peoples’ struggles, Marxist analysis of current events, and revolutionary theory ranging from basic to advanced, we hope this magazine will be a tool for furthering the movement against imperialism, capitalism, and all forms of oppression.  

Why Donate?

FIST members are actively organizing youth in Baltimore, Boston, Detroit, Durham, New York City, Philadelphia, and Rockford. We are constantly growing through our efforts to reach more young people with our revolutionary perspective and militant action.  

Red Flag is created by a volunteer cadre of multinational, working class, revolutionary young people.  We pour our heart and soul, our time and energy, and all of our available resources into each issue.  The magazine is free to view online and is available in print on a pay-what-you-can model.  Read the debut issue of Red Flag here!

Your donations will ensure our ability to continue documenting and advancing struggles against imperialist capitalist oppression. 100% of all donations and purchases go toward the production and distribution of the magazine.

Printing and distributing a revolutionary socialist magazine takes a lot of time, effort, and money.  Members of FIST are students and low-wage workers, and while our passion and dedication know no bounds, our monetary resources are limited.  With the support of our most loyal comrades and friends, FIST has grown by leaps and bounds over the past several years..

As racist police murder people of color with impunity throughout the world, as crises of overproduction leave millions jobless, and as austerity budgets threaten to eliminate the most basic social services, it is more important than ever that young people have access to a revolutionary Marxist point of view.  By donating, you can help make that happen.

What if I can't donate?

We understand that many of our supporters are unable to donate money.  That doesn't mean you can't help in the production of Red Flag!  

  • Share this campaign with your friends and comrades, in person and on social media.
  • Download or order our first issue of Red Flag and share it with your co-workers or classmates.
  • Find FIST on Facebook and connect with us!  
  • Consider forming a study group in your area with FIST reading material. Contact us for help doing so.
  • GET OUT IN THE STREETS!!! Support your local #BlackLivesMatter chapter, support low-wage workers' drives for $15/hr minimum wage and a union, protest US wars abroad

Revolutionary Love,

 Fight Imperialism, Stand Together
