story:
Who We Are

We recently launched a Philanthropy news website called www.PhilanthropistList.com that promotes philanthropy, charity, and acts of kindness to help introduce others to the world of philanthropy and giving. The intention of PhilanthropistList.com is that we want to raise the awareness that ANYONE can be a philanthropist.

Becoming a philanthropist doesn’t mean you have to be rich, successful or have a lot of money. A philanthropist is one who gives regardless of net worth or social status; this could be donating your time, knowledge, skills or personal belongings that you might not need. 

The goal of PhilanthropistList.com is to introduce newcomers — especially younger people — to the act of philanthropy and giving. Helping improve the quality of life for others, supporting causes through volunteering, and teaching others what you know can be this type of person. The selfless act of giving without getting anything in return is a great satisfaction and the message that the Philanthropist List wants to send out.

The practice of philanthropy, donating to good causes and lending a helping hand to others continues today, but the Philanthropist List wants to inspire even more people to give and promote the welfare of others through its philanthropy news website.

As the founder of Philanthropist List, I am asking for funding to help grow this great website and introduce others to the world of philanthropy.

What We Need & What You Get

Technical Help - This campaign is to help sustain and grow this recently launched website, www.Philanthropist.com into a platform that encourages others to give through its inspiring news stories, tips & advice, and ideas on how to give regardless of social status or net worth. In order to do this, the website needs to be maintained and hosted on high quality web hosting and servers to keep the site running smoothly. As our website continues to grow, we need funding to upgrade our web hosting and servers. We need to hire technical staff, such as system and network administrators to keep the site up and running and web developers to upgrade the features and functionality of the website.

Writers and Researchers - The website started with one writer and just recently added another.  Both writers voluntarily contribute philanthropy articles through their acts of kindness and giving. We would eventually like to compensate our writers for their efforts and also add more writers to produce more insightful and intuitive content for the website. We are looking for seed funding to hire more writers. Right now our writers are volunteers to keep costs down, but we know we need to hire more writers to produce more articles to keep this site going.

Marketing & Advertising – The founder of the Philanthropist List is an experienced Digital Marketing professional, but he can’t do the marketing and advertising alone. He needs the help of product marketing managers, advertising & marketing campaign managers, and recruitment marketing managers to help expose and bring more people to the website.

Business Analysts and Project Managers – In order to grow the website we also need to hire business analysts and project managers to understand our structure, policies, and operations of our organization, and to recommend solutions that enable Philanthropist List to achieve its goals.



Perks

$5 = A Virtual Thank You. A mention of your generosity will be posted on our Facebook and Twitter pages.

$50 = A personalized Thank You card will be sent to you by the Founder of the Philanthropist List.

$100 = You will be mentioned in our monthly newsletter as a valued contributor to the website.

$500 =  You will be mentioned in one of our articles to thank you for your contribution.

$1000 = You will receive all of the above and will have a permanent mention on a special section of our website called the “Top Philanthropist List Contributors” page.

The Impact

Your contribution will be a philanthropic act of giving. Your funding will be immensely important in helping grow PhilanthropistList.com so that it can help encourage others to give to charities, good causes, ideas and people in need. Your contributions will make a true and lasting impression by inspiring more people to give and participate in philanthropy as an effort to increase the well-being of humankind.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this page with friends and other potential philanthropists

  • Sharing with friends on social media
  • Posting on forums
  • Writing about it on your blog/site
  • Sharing to your e-mail list
  • Telling friends and family

story:
Hello. My name is Alixandrea La'terza Spateri. I am a twetny two year old writer from New York, and last year, I completeed my first novel, Ambiguity.

The novel had been stewing in my head for years, especially after reading so much fiction that relied soley on the stereotypical, heterosexual, romance. I became frustrated. 

I wanted to write something different. A book where characters have no names, unknown locations, and have their relationship be like everything else, ambigious. 

It is my dream to get this book published. But like most writers just starting out, this seems like a near impossibility without the proper support and funding. I find my situation to be even more difficult, considering the content of my novel. A novel where ideas about aromanticism and asexuality and gender variations are a main component of my story.

With your help, I will be able to get the publishing process going and will also be able to improve on the first version of Ambiguity. 

 

I have set a goal of $5,000, An amount of money that will be able to aid me in finding a professional editor, printing transcripts, and improving on my technology to make this process easier and far more refined in practice. 

the money will go to such things as 

  • Paying my brilliant cover artist, Cristel Schoen.
  • Pritning transcripts to be sent off to publishers.
  • Hiring a professional editor.
  • Purchasing a new computer where my writing can be refined and stored, and I can download more writing programs.
  • Creating open forum discussions on the topics within the novel
  • And looking into self publishing possibilities.

I also want to start a video series on the topics that can be insinuated from the novel, such as asexality, aromanticism, and gender variant people. Which are important things to get out there!

 

If you support and donate to this project, there will be perks! Such as being mentioned in the novel, personally signed copies of the novel, and, if this thing grows like I so wish it does, a meeting with me where we can discuss a novela tailored to your liking.

The Impact

I feel as though this novel will provide a positive resource for young adults, and adults alike. It will give people a chance to think outside of the heteronormative box, and also give people the chance to question the ways their own minds work and how they identitfy romance and love. There is an extreme lack of fictional literature that alludes to aromanticism, asxuality, and gender varient people. It will help people learn! And learning is the most important thing we can do.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot finacially donate, which in this day and age is completely understandable, you can help by simply spreading the word! Share it on your facebook, tumblr, twitter, etc. Besides raising funds, I want to create a community where people can be creative and share their ideas in a very safe space.

story:
Who We Are

Tuscany Press was founded in June 2012 as the first press dedicated to outstanding Catholic fiction and its authors and readers. 

Our Mission and Purpose

To spark the 21st-century Catholic fiction revival. 

We want to engage the culture and bring the Catholic perspective to the hearts of everyone with stories of faith and doubt; sin, forgiveness, and redemption; mystery and adventure; and love and God’s grace. 

For too long — not since J. R. R. Tolkien, Graham Greene, Walker Percy and Flannery O'Connor — the Catholic imagination has been missing in fiction. 

Tuscany Prize for Catholic Fiction

The Tuscany Prize for Catholic Fiction rewards the best undiscovered and unpublished Catholic novel, the most outstanding young-adult Catholic novel, and a selection of short stories with a Catholic theme.

We need your help to compete in a global market to attract writers, discover their talent, and bring their works of fiction to you. 

Please make your contribution to fund the Tuscany Prize for Catholic Fiction and help spark the revival!

Our goal is to raise the following prize monies:

  • Novel:  $10,000 
  • Young Adult Novel:  $5,000
  • Short Story, 1st Place:  $2,500
        Total: $17,500

All the money raised —100 percent — will be awarded to the winners in honor of their artistic achievements. Help us find the outstanding undiscovered works of Catholic fiction and their talented authors. 

Stretch Goal

If we surpass our original goal of $17,500 (thanks to all of you), we plan to fund the Tuscany Prize at the next level. That is,

  • Novel:  $15,000
  • Young Adult Novel:  $10,000
  • Short Story, 1st Place:  $5,000

         Total: $30,000

We are hoping and praying that, with the support of your contribution, we will achieve this stretch goal.

Your Impact

With your help, we can ignite the revival of Catholic fiction in the 21st century, and be able to compete in a global marketplace. 

There are more than 75 million Catholics in the United States and a billion worldwide. There are outstanding writers out there, and they have outstanding stories to tell.

Your support will enable us to:

•  attract writers 

•  discover outstanding stories of Catholic fiction

•  bring these stories with a Catholic perspective to you, your family, and your friends. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please consider sharing our mission to spark the 21st century Catholic fiction revival with your family and friends on social media. 

It’s as easy as liking our Facebook page or tweeting about it. A little can go a really long way. You can make an impact! 

A spark can ignite a flame, which can lead to a passion, which can create a movement. 

Simply click on the Facebook and Twitter buttons.

Thank you

We thank you deeply for all you have done or will do to spark the revival of Catholic fiction in the 21st century.

Sincerely,

Peter Mongeau, founder and publisher, and all the staff of Tuscany Press

Contact Information

If you have any questions, ideas or stories, please contact Peter Mongeau, Publisher of Tuscany Press at: publisher@tuscanypress.com

story:
Why Angie Thomson?

Angie has worked tirelessly, and at most times without a vacation or without pay, in order to save as many children as possible in the 20+ years since she left her high-paying job in the Silicon Valley to start Children's Relief Network and City of Hope. She is "mother", "grandmother", "friend", and "mentor" to literally hundreds of children who live in sewers and tunnels and on the streets.

  • My name is David McDonald and I left my much higher paying job as well (working as a graphic designer for a greeting card company) 13 years ago to work with Angie and Children's Relief Network. I have two adopted special needs boys and have been overseas 11 times to work with our projects since I began working with Angie.
  • My campaign is to raise enough funds to give Angie a much-needed, and well-deserved vacation and also to sustain the organization for a period of time due to economic hardship, the economy and a drop in donations in the past few years.
  • By giving to this campaign you will literally be saving this organization and hundreds of other children's and families lives who depend on Angie and this organization for hope and help. It means the difference between life and death. We are literally their only lifeline! 

What We Need & What You Get

Below are a few more details about what happens with your money:

  • Honestly, we'll take any funding that we can get. I am the U.S. Operations Director for Children's Relief Network. I was originally hired as the Graphic Designer because that is what my degree is in. As the years have gone by I have assumed more responsibilities (actually...I have assumed ALL of them lol) and am currently the only full-time U.S. employee.
  • This makes our overhead here in the States very, very low. Approximately 85% or more of the funds go directly to our projects. There are obviously Administrative costs, but I am the only full-time employee in the U.S. and am working at poverty level in order to put as much money as possible towards our projects and into our organization...that way your money is actually saving lives!
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, any and all funds will go to support our projects and to rescue and assist as many more homeless children and families that we are able.

The Impact

  • By giving to this campaign you will not only be helping to sustain and develop our projects with orphaned and abandoned street children and families, but you will be giving Angie and opportunity to take some time to revive, refresh and renew herself after her 20+ years of selfless sacrifice and love.
  • Children's Relief Network has been around 20 years this year. We are well-established and our track record speaks for itself.
  • Not only have hundreds of lives been impacted and saved, but we are ready to impact and save hundreds more...with your help!

Other Ways You Can Help

I'm a realist and understand that not everyone is going to be able to contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help or make a difference:

  • You can get the word out about Children's Relief Network and about Angie's efforts through word-of-mouth, social networking sites, etc.
  • You can also use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks for taking the time to consider this campaign!! :)
story_txt:
Why Angie Thomson?Angie has worked tirelessly, and at most times without a vacation or without pay, in order to save as many children as possible in the 20+ years since she left her high-paying job in the Silicon Valley to start Children's Relief Network and City of Hope. She is "mother", "grandmother", "friend", and "mentor" to literally hundreds of children who live in sewers and tunnels and on the streets.
My name is David McDonald and I left my much higher paying job as well (working as a graphic designer for a greeting card company) 13 years ago to work with Angie and Children's Relief Network. I have two adopted special needs boys and have been overseas 11 times to work with our projects since I began working with Angie.
My campaign is to raise enough funds to give Angie a much-needed, and well-deserved vacation and also to sustain the organization for a period of time due to economic hardship, the economy and a drop in donations in the past few years.
By giving to this campaign you will literally be saving this organization and hundreds of other children's and families lives who depend on Angie and this organization for hope and help. It means the difference between life and death. We are literally their only lifeline! 
What We Need & What You GetBelow are a few more details about what happens with your money:
Honestly, we'll take any funding that we can get. I am the U.S. Operations Director for Children's Relief Network. I was originally hired as the Graphic Designer because that is what my degree is in. As the years have gone by I have assumed more responsibilities (actually...I have assumed ALL of them lol) and am currently the only full-time U.S. employee.
This makes our overhead here in the States very, very low. Approximately 85% or more of the funds go directly to our projects. There are obviously Administrative costs, but I am the only full-time employee in the U.S. and am working at poverty level in order to put as much money as possible towards our projects and into our organization...that way your money is actually saving lives!
If we don't reach our entire goal, any and all funds will go to support our projects and to rescue and assist as many more homeless children and families that we are able.
The Impact
By giving to this campaign you will not only be helping to sustain and develop our projects with orphaned and abandoned street children and families, but you will be giving Angie and opportunity to take some time to revive, refresh and renew herself after her 20+ years of selfless sacrifice and love.

Children's Relief Network has been around 20 years this year. We are well-established and our track record speaks for itself.
Not only have hundreds of lives been impacted and saved, but we are ready to impact and save hundreds more...with your help!
Other Ways You Can HelpI'm a realist and understand that not everyone is going to be able to contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help or make a difference:
You can get the word out about Children's Relief Network and about Angie's efforts through word-of-mouth, social networking sites, etc.
You can also use the Indiegogo share tools!
Thanks for taking the time to consider this campaign!! :)

story:
Be Inspired!

My name is Liam and I am now 42 years old...
Orphaned, battling a heavy spastic and a heart defect, born in the wrong body, I always met adversity head-on, making horrifying as well as beautiful experiences along the way, meeting people that changed my life. Hopefully my book will touch lives, or maybe even change them.

Check the 'gallery' tab on this page to see another video
about my book, my dreams, and how it all came about.
Read more about the story on my blog: http://liamklenk.wordpress.com/about/

My memoirs are an emotional journey, painfully honest, straight from the heart. They will  make you laugh, will make you cry, and hopefully most of all they will brighten your  days with adventures spanning 2 bodies, 8 countries, 10 professions, countless  challenges, as well as countless comical encounters and developments along  the way.

Watch the video accompanying my campaign for more insight. I need your help so I can write this book and make a difference in the world. I can't do it without you and hope with all my heart to have you on the team!


Book Sneak Peeks

Visit the notes section of my book's Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/thefortunatenomad/notes or my blog http://liamklenk.wordpress.com/ Until the manuscript is finished I will publish weekly sneak peeks chosen at random from any of the sixteen chapters...

I Need Your Help

I have tried for many years to write this book while working full time. It is simply impossible. To get the narrative flowing, be consistent, and intense, you need to focus all your energy, and immerse yourself in your story.
Consequently I gave up my job and started writing in October 2013.

My 1st draft is almost finished by now. I am working hard and expect to be finished with the 1st draft by beginning of March. Then I will have to start at chapter 1 again to fine tune. My memoirs will have 16 chapters. I hope to finish the 3rd and final draft of my manuscript by the end of April 2014. I have signed up with an Australian self-publishing house that is willing to publish my book.

What I am hoping for is that with your help I can find the calm and peace of mind for just three to four more months to work full-time on my manuscript and have it ready for publishing. Your contribution will make it possible for me to cover all publishing-related costs! (more details in the last section on this page)

In exchange for your contributions I can offer a range of attractive perks. More than anything your contribution will let you become an existential part of this journey. You will make a difference and help get a story out there that needs to be told. I will mention all contributors, who want me to, in the Acknowledgement section of my book.

Inspiration

My book hopes to inspire and aims to reach into as many living rooms and hearts around the world as possible!

Spread the Word

You can follow me on Twitter https://twitter.com/liamklenk.
Or follow my book's Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/thefortunatenomad
Please 'LIKE' and spread the word about my coming book!

Traditional Publishing House?

My publishing agreement with the Self-Publishing company Xlibris is non-exclusive. I am free to enter into any other agreements at any time.
If you have any contacts that will enable me to get the interest of a traditional publishing house already at this stage, please send me a private message. Any publisher willing to indulge me for a moment will discover my book as a little sparkling star with the potential to light up the night sky if given half a chance!

Idea, Plan, and Budget...

More information here: https://www.facebook.com/notes/the-fortunate-nomad/insights-into-liams-campaign-on-indiegogo/531263460320790

This book is the dream of a life time. I realized very strongly, that I'VE GOT EXACTLY ONE CHANCE TO DO THIS RIGHT AND MAKE IT COUNT. So many things that happened in my life could give others hope as well as new perspectives. I want to turn my experiences into something meaningful.

Initially I will go through a self-publishing company to get my book out there. The plan is however to deliver such professional high quality in writing, as well as layout to be able to make the jump to a traditional publishing house straight after. I am convinced I have the talent, dedication, and professionalism to give a book to the world that will be remembered for a very long time. More importantly I think my story will be able to lighten people's hearts and inspire them.

I will need to pay 5,000 USD to the Australian publishing company who will initially publish my book (I paid them already but had to borrow the money). This initial amount will be followed by 10,000 to 12,000 USD for professional editing fees (confirmed) as soon as I begin with my second draft. The editor and I will go over everything together, fine-tuning prose as much as grammar. Marketing and agent fees will follow.

I have given it all. Dedicated to writing full time I have spent all my savings and am in fact bankrupt by now, surviving for the moment on the kindness of my amazing father who has believed in me all my life.

Thank you all for indulging me, being curious, reading all the way, maybe even contributing, or telling your friends about this campaign. Books have the power to change lives. Eventually, with your help, I hope 'The Fortunate Nomad' will touch the lives of many...

story:
1913 a journal of forms & 1913 Press

Since 2003, 1913 a journal of forms/1913 Press has been committed to publishing the finest & baddest in poetry, prose, poetics, art and their intersections.

To date, we have published 5 gorgeous print issues of 1913 a journal of forms, and we are currently launching our first ever online Issue #6 as a free PDF, with a purchase print option.

With 1913 Press, we have published 8 beautiful & brilliant books by John Keene & Christopher Stackhouse, Shin Yu Pai, Biswamit Dwibedy, Diane Wald, Arielle Greenberg & Rachel Zucker, Srikanth Reddy & Dan Beachy-Quick, Karena Youtz, and Jane Lewty.

With this fundraiser, we are looking to support 1913 Press and its 2013-2014 season, which features new, exciting, groundbreaking books by: 

Monica Mody

Mendi+Keith Obadike

Brad Flis

Scott McFarland

Brenda Iijima

Sarah Riggs

Amaranth Borsuk & Kate Durbin! 

We also hope to help fund a small print run of 1913 a journal of forms Issue 6, keeping this work on paper, as well as online.  

And we are launching a new chapbook imprint with a wonderful new work by CA Conrad!

Next season’s books include superb new works by Lily Hoang, Sommer Browning & Noah Eli Gordon, Ronaldo V. Wilson, and the winner of 1913’s 2014 First Book Prize, to be judged by the brilliant Claudia Rankine.

Truly an indie micro press, 1913 has always depended on the kindness of donations large and small to see these collective endeavors into the world. 

Any contribution, mammoth or miniature, will help!


Our Current Fundraiser

In addition to private donations of all sizes and our two reading periods, founder/editrice Sandra Doller & vice-editor/designer Ben Doller keep 1913 Press running with personal funds from our university teaching jobs. We feel fortunate to be able to bring out exceptional cross-genre literary art works into the world.

Each year, we conduct a fundraiser via email, which has allowed us to publish the truly magnificent work in 1913 a journal of forms &1913 Press. This year, we are trying all sorts of new things. In addition to a web journal and more web content, we are crowdfunding for supporters to specifically fund our 2013-2014 season, which promises to be the most prolific and exciting yet.

Our goal of $25,000 will go directly to pay for printing costs for our always-beautiful, well-designed books by some of today’s most thrilling verbal artists. Those familiar with publishing know that it costs on average $3,000-$5,000 to print an economical run of 750-1000 copies of one book. This year, we are also publishing 2 full-color artists books by the incredible Mendi+Keith Obadike, 1 of which includes an audio CD.

Our perks for donors include everlasting gratitude, honorary status of “low modernist,” as well as some fantastic 1913 Press items from buttons to books.

If we do not reach our goal of $25,000, all funds donated will contribute to the printing costs for the first 3 books of our season: Monica Mody’s Kala Pani and Mendi+Keith Obadike’s Four Electric Ghosts and Big House/Disclosure. 

If we reach our funding goal, we will be able to publish sooner rather than later this season’s remaining books by Brad Flis, Scott McFarland, Brenda Iijima, Sarah Riggs, Amaranth Borsuk & Kate Durbin,  and the CA Conrad chapbook. We will also be able to publish a small print run of 1913 a journal of forms Issue 6, in addition to the web version.


Join the 1913 Famille

We are honored to put these works into print, and we hope you share our excitement. Our community of writers, artists, performers, editors, readers is an inclusive and friendly one. Please join us!

Even if you are unable to help financially, we hope you can help us spread the word about this campaign to fund these wonderful books...

Thanks for your support,

Sandra & Ben & 1913

story:
Short Summary

I've been writing since I was eight years old. I've been writing and performing poetry since 1995. At the heart of why I write is, a need to live out the dream that I had when I was younger of being a successful writer on my own terms. After publishing two books in 2008 & 2010, I wound up in a turbulent period in my life. I was frantically searching for work. I was in a malaise, one I thought I couldn't get out of. I even began to listen to the doubters, that my dream was a waste of time. But I slowly began to fight back, and wrote myself out of it. And the fruit of that four years of labor is PENNY CANDY RHYTHMS. A book of poetry that gives hope that we can all still hold onto the sweetness of life no matter what bitterness comes.

The Rundown.


  • Specifically, I need $500. This cost will cover the first print run of a hundred copies of PENNY CANDY RHYTHMS, promotional materials, and shipping materials.
  • You'll get some nice perks if you donate, perks that I feel will tie in with the book's overall message. And besides, it's the least I can do to give love back to those who'll show love to me by donating.
  • To be upfront, if this campaign isn't successful, I still intend to publish the book, and all proceeds will go directly towards that. Nowhere else.
  • The Impact
  • To me, this third book means a lot. It will be a triumphant moment because with all of the personal and professional struggles I've had, getting PENNY CANDY RHYTHMS published on my own imprint with your help will mean that you value my writing. And that you value what I bring to you and the rest of the community by supporting and helping 108 Press to grow this way.
  • I've already successfully self-published two books, 'lovestoned' and 'wife of the heart'. 'lovestoned' sold out its first run in two months. both books are still great sellers and have really touched people in a meaningful way.
  • We all have stories. Stories that get swept aside, overlooked or deemed not important. My writing is my way of continuing to tell my story without any hesitation or restraint. Because I believe that what lies in the pieces found in PENNY CANDY RHYTHMS is stuff that we've all seen, dealt with or have gone through. And that when you get down to it, our stories all have the common core to it. One that ultimately will help us get better and do better for ourselves and those around us.

Other Ways You Can Help

I do realize that in these times, folks may not be able to donate for different reasons. But you ask, what CAN I do?

  • It's simple. Share this campaign with your friends and loved ones. Even your co-workers. Spread the word!!!
  • And if you choose to spread the word, Indiegogo has some great share tools that you can use!!

I hope that this summation gives you an idea of how important getting PENNY CANDY RHYTHMS is to me. And I hope to have your support, however that may come. Thank you for taking the time to read this. Peace and love!!

story:
Change

We are in a desperate need of it.

Whether we talk about society, politics, economy or digital divide.

Have you felt at least once that the world goes wrong? How often have you seen your friends or family complaining of the "current state of affairs"?

Bulgaria is the poorest, least developed and likewise most corrupted country in the European Union. We, as Europeans have the freedom to work and live everywhere in the EU. Yet we choose to live in Bulgaria. We believe that even the poorest country in the EU deserves to be a prospering place to live in.

To achieve that, we will have to effect some changes. To kickstart the change, though, we have to spring into action and participate in politics.  

Together

We started establishing DEOS, a political party of a new type. Now you might be wondering who we are and this is perfectly fine.  

We are a group of concerned Bulgarians who are saying "enough". We believe the change potential sits within every one of us.

What will we do to initiate change:

  • We are developing a model to shake up the basics of political representation. We believe in empowering people to actively participate in political decisions;
  • Our model will transform the political parties from the power brokers of today to the transparent opinion builders and opinion leaders of tomorrow;
  • Bulgaria is not governed by rules, but by deals and corruption instead. We will work to complete the transition from arbitrary deal making towards a predictive rule of law;
  • Education forms the foundation of our children's future. Today it is done all wrong. Empowering active parents and kids to decide on their education formats is a key change we aim to achieve

Reach out

We need your help. The applicable legislation provides for a long, tedious and expensive process of establishing a political party.

We initiate our indiegogo campaign to:

  • reach to our fellow Bulgarians home and abroad, who dream of a change and are willing to make it happen - online and on site
  • finance the initial general assembly gathering of DEOS
  • further develop the model of political change we as founders of DEOS envision

We call for the support of all of you, Bulgarians or not, living in Bulgaria, European countries, USA, Canada or elsewhere.

Help us change Bulgaria! Our success could be the role-model to change the world!

Background

Hey guys, my name is Eric Sachetta. I am an author and motivational speaker to college students on the topic of Leadership.
* My campaign funds will be used to send free copies of my book to community colleges throughout the nation. The goal is to reach out to schools to see if they would be interested in using my book as part of their leadership programs or speaker series.
* I have sent my book to many of the top four year universities across the nation and received a great response.
* The reason this campaign is so important is that many of the programs I am going to implement at four year colleges won't begin until next fall. That being said, without your contribution to this campaign I will probably have to wait until the 2015-2016 school year to reach out and create programs with community colleges.
*With your contribution I will be able to send my book to community colleges throughout the nation and create programs with them for the 2014-2015 school year. Your contribution will mean the world to me and the students that will be impacted by the book and program. Who knows, your contribution might put a book in the hands of the next great leader in our country.

What We Need & What You Get

* The goal of the campaign is $7500. I will be able to send my book to 500 community colleges. The cost to pay for the fulfillment of one book in my campaign and to pay for one free copy sent to a college is $15. So to add it up 500 books X $15 (a free book & a campaign fulfilled book) = $7500.
  • Most of the perks revolve around copies of my book. The more books you buy the better the deal. The book you give to a friend or family member may change their perspective and launch them into a life of leadership.
  • I want to clarify one of the perks ($1500 instructor guide). This perk is extremely exciting! Basically, for $1500 I am allowing you to teach the material from the book using the instructor guide. You can offer a free course or a paid course. Basically you could start your own little business teaching my material!
  • If I don't achieve my goal I will only be able to send my book to select community colleges. I really want to be able to offer my program to as many colleges as possible. As many of you know, you can't really tell who is interested in a product or service until you let potential customers try it, use it, see it, and experience it.

The Impact

  • Now more than ever the world needs more leaders. With your contribution you'll receive a book to help improve your leadership skills as well as sponsor the opportunity for students at community colleges to enhance their leadership skills.
  • I know how much of an impact a book like this would have had on my life when I was in college. For me, it's not about the money; it's about the impact. It's about knowing that because I shared my story someone else is going to have a better life. That's what it's all about.

Other Ways You Can Help

* If by chance you can't contribute at this time thank you very much for checking out the campaign. Please spread the word on social media, email, or general word of mouth. You never know, someone you tell might contribute and their contribution may bring my program to a large community college that will cultivate a new generation of student leaders.

The goal is to reach out to schools to see if they would be interested in using my book as part of their leadership programs or speaker series. * I have sent my book to many of the top four year universities across the nation and received a great response.* The reason this campaign is so important is that many of the programs I am going to implement at four year colleges won't begin until next fall. That being said, without your contribution to this campaign I will probably have to wait until the 2015-2016 school year to reach out and create programs with community colleges. *With your contribution I will be able to send my book to community colleges throughout the nation and create programs with them for the 2014-2015 school year. Your contribution will mean the world to me and the students that will be impacted by the book and program. Who knows, your contribution might put a book in the hands of the next great leader in our country.What We Need & What You Get* The goal of the campaign is $7500. I will be able to send my book to 500 community colleges. The cost to pay for the fulfillment of one book in my campaign and to pay for one free copy sent to a college is $15. So to add it up 500 books X $15 (a free book & a campaign fulfilled book) = $7500.
Most of the perks revolve around copies of my book. The more books you buy the better the deal. The book you give to a friend or family member may change their perspective and launch them into a life of leadership. 

I want to clarify one of the perks ($1500 instructor guide). This perk is extremely exciting! Basically, for $1500 I am allowing you to teach the material from the book using the instructor guide. You can offer a free course or a paid course. Basically you could start your own little business teaching my material!

If I don't achieve my goal I will only be able to send my book to select community colleges. I really want to be able to offer my program to as many colleges as possible. As many of you know, you can't really tell who is interested in a product or service until you let potential customers try it, use it, see it, and experience it.

The Impact
Now more than ever the world needs more leaders. With your contribution you'll receive a book to help improve your leadership skills as well as sponsor the opportunity for students at community colleges to enhance their leadership skills.

I know how much of an impact a book like this would have had on my life when I was in college. For me, it's not about the money; it's about the impact. It's about knowing that because I shared my story someone else is going to have a better life. That's what it's all about. 

Other Ways You Can Help* If by chance you can't contribute at this time thank you very much for checking out the campaign. Please spread the word on social media, email, or general word of mouth. You never know, someone you tell might contribute and their contribution may bring my program to a large community college that will cultivate a new generation of student leaders.

story:
THE PROJECT:

The Locusts on the Horizon project is devoted to reaching those who are unprepared for the coming economic crisis or natural disasters.  Our goal is to define an affordable preparedness plan to those who cannot afford a retreat in the country, one that also allows families to remain intact and to thrive rather than merely survive. We believe this can be done without adopting an entirely new lifestyle and without investing a life savings. We are the three-year collaboration of a group of people who have been involved in preparation, finance, military service, law enforcement, nomadic living, shooting sports, outdoor pursuits, and technology.  There will never be a sole author of our publications, we aggregate the views of many writers into a single collection of work so that all information is vetted by a group.


WE HAVE TWO CURRENT GOALS:

One of the most frequent emails we receive from our readers is “Where can I buy a printed copy?”  This has been a goal of the team for quite some time now however the big challenge has been the upfront costs to get started because the reality is, this is a HUGE book!  We are primarily using this campaign to finally offer printed copies of the book.

In addition, we are advertising our project on Coast to Coast AM in order to get the word out.  We strongly believe that many people can benefit from seeing their preparations in a completely different way.  The goal is a plan that is affordable and attainable by nearly anyone, does not require a lifetime of commitment and most importantly does not compromise the financial stability of the family.

In order to continue to advertise we need some help.  This entire project has been self-funded so far and we are reaching out to the community at large to help us spread the word.


OUR PRODUCTS:

Locusts on the Horizon

Locusts on the Horizon is much more than simply another prepper book. This exhaustive work uses facts, history, and actual events as a guide to show you what to expect from an economic depression and how any average family can meet the challenges.

Traditional "prepping” philosophies tend to focus on escaping to a prepared retreat in the countryside. However, most American middle class families, even those who still have jobs, are only three or fewer missing paychecks away from financial disaster and they simply cannot afford a fixed location, rural retreat.

With a few basic preparations and some planning done right now, anyone of any income level can weather the coming crisis. This can position you to survive, adapt, and thrive in the face of whatever the future holds.

Locusts on the Horizon will be offered as a high-quality 8.5 by 11 hard-bound book, similar to a college textbook.  The final printed version will be somewhere around 600 pages in this large printed format.  The eBook version is over 1200 pages long in the Kindle format.

The Family Survival Gun

With the majority of the US population now financially stressed and millions attempting to prepare themselves to face an uncertain future, this book answers an important question, “What to do if a family can only afford one firearm?”

The Family Survival Gun zeroes in on the primary firearm a family should own if they can afford no other. It is a deep, focused look at the sole firearm a family really needs to own and why. The book then focuses upon that one firearm, how to use it, how to keep it running, repaired, and fed with ammunition indefinitely.

The Family Survival Gun is both a standalone work, and an expansion upon our foundational publication, Locusts on the Horizon. Reading Locusts on the Horizon is not a prerequisite to reading this book however; previous readers of Locusts on the Horizon will recognize a small portion of the information presented in this book. There is also a tremendous amount of additional information.

The Family Survival Gun will also be offered as an 8.5 by 11 book but will be a soft cover.  The final printed version will be approximately 200 pages.


THE PERKS:

The perks for our campaign are very simple:

  • We have a high quality hat with the Locusts on the Horizon Project logo on the front.
  • We have printed copies of our two books.
  • In addition to those, we'll be sending a signed high quality print to every contributor.  It will be in the style of our project and suitable for framing.  
  • Also, each backer will be added to our mailing list (if desired) in order to receive future updates about the project.

There is one special perk that is available to only a few backers however.   We are offering a 90 minute telephone consultation with two of the project authors to discuss any topics you would like in regard to your current or future preparations.  We will send you a questionnaire prior to the phone call so that we are fully prepared to address your specific needs.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP:

If you cannot contribute, there are still ways you can help.  Please share this campaign with all of your friends and family.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools or send an email, a voicemail, a tweet, a poke, a facebook message, a smoke signal or a carrier pigeon.

story:
Short Summary

  For 4 months, from June to October of 2013, I traveled 12.000mi across US while making over 300 tintype plates along the way.  Each tintype is not only unique simply by the nature of the process, but each one also comes with a set of memories that surround it's creation.  A story of the journey will be combined into an illustrated memoir-style book told in 'passages' - a page or so of writing to accompany each image.  As rewards for your contributions you will own the original draft of that passage, getting a chance to read it well before the book is published, AND the original plate that goes with it!  Each passage and plate will be personally signed.

More About the Book

   After learning the process I found myself completely in love with wet plate photography.  It was only natural that I would want to fuse it with my love of traveling.  So it was decided - the second Photo Palace Bus cross-country trip was to be dedicated to making tintypes and ambrotypes!  You can learn all about wet plate photography HERE and The Photo Palace Bus HERE, but for right now let's concentrate on this book project and what led up to it, shall we?

  Starting in San Diego I drove to Seattle and then across the continent on to Maine and D.C., before taking Route 66 all the way back from Chicago to Los Angeles.  Everywhere I went I stopped and made tintypes of scenes and people that excited and inspired me.  I met many wonderful characters along the way while showing people how the process works, visited photographers and other friends, found myself lost amid the mountains of Montana and stuck in traffic in Chicago.  I took major freeways, minor highways, small roads and windy dirt covered paths.  Usually I would make 1-2 plates at a time because of the time it took to set up the chemistry and equipment, compose, expose and process the image and to break down the whole setup.  From the joys of the open road to the despair of having a broken transmission while being 3000mi from home, all the trials and triumphs will be described in the book.

  Traveling across 30 states I gathered as many memories as I did plates and now I would like to share them with You and the world.  I kept a blog during the journey, but there was no time to tell the story behind each image no matter how fun or fascinating they were.  Now I can want to dedicate as much attention to each photograph as they truly deserve.  It will be a visual diary with about one page of writing per image or an image pair.

  I envision this book in three parts: 1 - Camp Tintype and Before, 2 - New England and After, 3 - Route 66.  Chapters in each part will be made from short passages printed by the image or images they describe.  Those passages and tintypes that go along with them are offered as rewards in this campaign.

  There are a lot of images and just as many memories, so there's a lot of writing and recollection to be done.  After receiving your contribution I will make a good digital copy of each plate for the book before sending it to you (that will be a lot of work by itself).  The book will be published once ALL the plates are sold and all the stories are written.

Rewards

  Here is the most exciting part - you can own one of these beautiful tintypes (or ambrotypes) AND get a chance to see the writing that goes with it well ahead of everyone else!  I will send you the plate along with the passage - you will be the first one to read it's story and when the book is published you will know that you own one of the original plates. 

 Although it is my preference as an artist to select a plate that you will receive as a thanks for your contribution you can indeed take a look at THE BLOG (at posts from June to August 2013) and after making your contribution let me know your first three choices of plates you liked.  Some plates are already sold, but I will do the best to fulfill your desires.  If you chose to select a plate for yourself you please include your top three selections with a message though here or, after making a contribution, send me an email at thephotopalace@gmail.com.

   I can not begin to tell you how much more beautiful a real tintype is when compared to a quick iPhone JPEG copy that I have placed on the blog or even the final print in the book.  Even though I will make sure that prints in the book will be of the best possible quality, nothing can compare to the seemingly infinite detail of the original wet plate image and the way the light shimmers on the surface of millions of silver particles.  It is truly a sight to behold.
 
  There is a limited amount of plates available - reserve one for yourself by pledging your support.  I should also mention that there is of course no limit on how many times you can pledge and how many passages and plates you can get.

  To get a taste for my writing style you can read THIS ENORMOUS BLOG ENTRY.  In the book a lot more attention will be paid to each specific image, but reading that blog entry should give you an idea of what to expect.

  Single Plates and Passages - I created a lot of 3.5x4.5in plates, a lot less of 4x6in ones and even fewer 7.25x9.25in ones.  While traveling across the continent I was selling my plates for $250, $350 and $600 depending on the size and had a good amount of plates were indeed sold.  Now I am lowering the price to make them more affordable to all interested.  That said, I would like to encourage those who can afford to do so to make contributions at or above the original asking price.
  There are only 2 of 8x20in monster-size plates and those are priced accordingly higher.
 
  ROUTE 66, AN ENTIRE 3rd CHAPTER - ONE lucky individual will have a chance to buy an entire 3rd chapter of the book.  All of the Route 66 images (except for the very first plate, that has already been bought before I started this project) will stay together.  That is 117 out of 118 images!  Don't worry - the first image actually has an almost identical twin taken from the exact same camera position but with a longer lens.  I would like for one person to own them because they create a beautifully consistent body of work that someday I hope will be exhibited all together.
  If you are considering this monumental purchase feel free to check out the images you'll be getting HERE.  There is a bit of general writing there as well, which I plan to expand greatly to get into the details about each image.
 

About the Funding Goal

  Obviously I set the full funding of this campaign WAY too low for publishing the entire book.  I did that with the aim of quickly reaching the goal and not having to lose the extra 4% in fees.  It is my hope that the goal will be surpassed by far and that many more contributors will pitch in than needed for full funding to be achieved.  This is a campaign that is aimed at helping me write the stories and distributing them and the accompanying images across the globe.  Again, the full book will be published only after ALL (or at least 90% of) the plates are sold.

  Maybe you love the idea, but you just can't contribute.  Maybe you have already contributed and want to see this book come to fruition.  Either way -  please help out by spreading the word about this campaign.


Thank you!

story:
The Bucket List

I am well on my way to checking off a major item on my bucket list - having a book published. I have a completed manuscript.  Now I need an agent or a publisher. Ideally, both. 
I've done my homework. I have a query letter all ready to go. But my research says that actually meeting some agents and publishers in person will give me a huge head start in the highly competitive world of getting published.

Enter the Writers' Conference

The best way to interact with agents and publishers is to attend a writers' conference. It's even better if you can get to one that's specific to your book's genre. Killer Nashville is a conference for writers of thrillers, mysteries, suspense and crime fiction. My book is a legal thriller, so it's a great fit.

Here's the break down of what it will cost for me to attend this conference:

  • $275 for registration - $230 for the conference and $45 for a manuscript critique from an agent.
  • $495 for lodging - 3 nights at $150 per night plus $15 per day for parking.
  • $115 for the three tanks of gas I anticipate the drive down and back will require. It takes about $35 to fill the tank on my Prius, and I'll get about 48 miles to the gallon on the interstate.
  • $115 for meals. 

About the Book

My book is called "The Dark Side of Grace." It tells the story of Grace Kelly Quinn, an idealistic young lawyer in the St. Louis public defender's office who gets her big break to move up the ranks when she is assigned to assist her boss in representing Allen Davis, a man who walked into the local police station and confessed to abusing his sons. 

As it appears more and more likely that Grace may actually help get her client acquitted, she finds herself torn between her personal morals, her professional ambition, her legal ethics, and her own dark past. The case puts her budding relationship with her longtime friend Ronan, her mental well-being, and even her life in jeopardy, until she finally comes to a shocking conclusion as to how to resolve the conflicting interests that are pulling at her.

story:
Z. Royale

I write psychological, erotic, queer, avant-garde, romance. 

This past summer, I moved to Amsterdam after 16 years living in NYC. Now in this slower paced, open-minded, peaceful environment, it is easier for me to take the time to process my experiences and write. Personally, I got tired of reading the same formulaic erotic stories. I took this erotic reading frustration and turned it into inspiration. What I write is diverse. I believe everyone has specific, erotic desires and that's what I like to learn and write about. My writing includes all people (trans, gender nonconforming, feminine, masculine spectrums) and an array of sexual preferences. 

Appetite. is my first novel published last year. It is about a contrasexual woman who loves and cooks with reckless abandonment, but who is going to satisfy her craving? 

Get a sneak peek into Chapter excerpts, which will be attached throughout the campaign.

In addition to writing, I am also performing erotic reading installations (forming an erotic environment based on themes) at clubs/galleries like The Vrankrijk, OT301, Paradiso, and most recently for Lars Von Trier's opening of Nymphomaniac. I also enjoy doing readings on Queeristan radio and conducting erotic writing workshops at book stores and other spaces. Besides writing, performing, and running workshops, I will help start an erotic library with Bibliotheque Erotique and contribute to a new zine called Sensual Ethics next year. 

There is lots in motion and I need your support to keep the erotic writing flowing. Please help me raise the funds to continue my cause: to bring erotica back to life; combatting superficial, habitual ideas around sexuality through books; exploring more ways that we can cultivate our erotic worlds through words. 

What's in it for you:

  • A free, signed copy of Appetite. my first novel
  • An astrological erotic reading
  • Hosting in Amsterdam (I will show you the underground, erotic culture, tailored just for you) 
  • A private breakfast, lunch, erotic reading dinner party when I am in your town

Supporting my cause will make an impact:

  • Expand the definition of 'erotic' 
  • Include queer, fetish, and solo loving
  • Relatable to all people, progressive, and non-discriminatory

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute at this time:

  • Let others know about my book Appetite! It can be purchased online at Ellora's Cave or Amazon or Barnes & Noble
  • Come and support my readings, performances, and writing workshops!!

I also enjoy doing readings on Queeristan radio and conducting erotic writing workshops at book stores and other spaces. Besides writing, performing, and running workshops, I will help start an erotic library with Bibliotheque Erotique and contribute to a new zine called Sensual Ethics next year. 
There is lots in
motion and I need your support to keep the erotic writing flowing. Please help me
raise the funds to continue my cause: to bring erotica back to life; combatting superficial, habitual ideas around sexuality through books; exploring more ways that we can cultivate our erotic worlds through words. What's in it for
you:

A free, signed copy of Appetite. my first novel
An astrological erotic reading
Hosting in Amsterdam (I will show you the underground, erotic
     culture, tailored just for you) 
A private breakfast, lunch, erotic reading dinner party when I am
     in your town
Supporting my cause will make an impact:

Expand the definition of 'erotic' 
Include queer, fetish, and solo loving
Relatable to all people, progressive, and non-discriminatory
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't
contribute at this time:

Let others know about my book Appetite! It can be purchased online
     at Ellora's Cave or Amazon or Barnes
     & Noble

Come and support my readings, performances, and writing workshops!!

story:
Strength From Within: Stories of Recovery to Fund Asbury House

Recovery from addiction requires strength, and through strength can come recovery. But not all strengths are the same, nor are all addictions. Strength From Within aims to examine addiction and recovery through the lens of fantasy. With fifteen stories of bravery, strength and resilience in the face of addiction and recovery, this anthology showcases established authors as well as up and coming talent.

All profits are to go to Asbury House. The support from this project will go to give Asbury House a home in Fort Collins, CO and give women the space to learn their strengths and build on them to recover.

"The mission of Asbury House is to provide a safe, holistic, and healthy physical environment where women are empowered to collaboratively develop their healing process keeping in mind their relationships with their families, communities, and environments, so that they are able to make more meaningful choices and achieve successful relationships, life goals, and economic productivity on their chosen paths."

With your help, this project can bring hope and help to women who truly need it. We need your support today, and you'll get our book tomorrow. 

 

What We Need & What You Get 

  • Although Asbury house can use more than $5,000 to purchase their house, this will go a long way towards helping them reach their goal. By funding this anthology, all profits will go to the charity from sales of the book as well.  UPDATE: After more consideration, and more math involved, half of the money raised will have to go to printing, shipping and paying authors for the anthology and the rest of the money we raise will go straight to Asbury House. Further funds raised from the sale of the anthology through Amazon will go straight to the charity. 

  • More details on Asbury house, their goals, and their mission can be found at http://asburyhouse.org/

  • $1 – For the love – Our gratitude             

    $10 – For the ones and zeroes – A copy of the ebook

    $15 – For the book – A trade paperback copy of the anthology

    $25 – For the both – A copy of the ebook and a copy of the trade paperback

    $50 – For the sign – A copy of the trade paperback with a handwritten thank you note from the editor.

    $50 – For the acknowledgements – Included in the acknowledgements page of the book with our undying gratitude as well as a copy of the trade paperback or ebook, your choice. 

    $100 – For the edits – Short story critique (Up to 5,000 words) from the editor. Plus a copy of the trade paperback. 

    $1000 – For the win – Did we mention undying gratitude, let's talk undying everlasting gratitude. Oh, and all of the above stuff. 

  • If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds will go to Asbury House no matter what, however, the Anthology might not go through if I can't pay my authors and fund the printing and shipping costs. 

 

The Impact

  • Asbury House will offer their clients  world class treatment in a holistic, safe, and nurturing environment  where they will promote a sense of community, provide individual therapy, group therapy, competent assessment, 12-Step based education,  case management, sustainable nutritional health education and integrated fitness programs.

    Their treatment program focuses on the whole person, including issues related to mind, body and spirit.  To accomplish this we utilize evidence based practice as well as accepted standards of alternative holistic healing approaches. We see our clients as partners in their recovery who are empowered to participate in the decision making process concerning their treatment. Each individual is unique and as a result we work with the client to determine their individualized treatment needs.  

    Asbury House’s program is designed as extended care as an essential component of success to treat drug and alcohol addiction in addition to the underlying mental health and trauma issues that have contributed to substance abuse and or substance dependency in women. 

  • With your contribution, you can help to make this a reality for women in a community that has no such program. Not only will you provide a safe, caring environment for women to develop their strengths and overcome the adversity of addiction and psychological issues, but also you will be providing a service that is badly needed in our community. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please repost, share, reblog, tweet and spread the word!

  • Submit your story to the anthology

 

Submission Guidelines

Original material only, no reprints will be accepted. Do not use non-original characters and/or copyrighted characters. Romance is fine, erotica is inappropriate for the anthology. No rape, no excessive violence.

Word count 2-6K, query for longer.
 
Payment is a flat $25 per story.
 
Submissions open from July 27th through October 31st.
 
To submit, save your document as .doc or .rtf and email your submissions with attachment to strengthfromwithinanthology [@] gmail [dot] com. Questions and queries may also be directed to this email.

For published pieces we take First Print and/or Electronic Publishing Rights. Bear in mind that most publications will not publish pieces that have been published in print, eBook, or on the web, so for all intents and purposes after your work is published by us it can only be marketed as a reprint, which severely limits the number of markets that will accept it, and drastically reduces the pay rate it can receive. It is up to you, the author, to decide if publishing your work in print and eBook, giving up your First Publishing Right for a token payment, is really what you want to do.

story:
I have qualified for the National Poetry Slam as a member of the Phoenix NPS Team. Trips don't pay for themselves though, here's where you come in!

I'm awesome...but I'm also a teacher (read: broke).

So, a little bit about myself...

  • Those of you in the poetry community know me as Charles Levett, the rest of you know me as Mr. Terry

  • I have been slamming competitively since 2009 and have qualified for 2 different National Poetry Slam Teams. In 2010 I took a long break from poetry, but have returned and can't wait to head to Charlotte, NC to represent Phoenix.

  • I am 7-8 Science Teacher at Capitol Elementary School for Phoenix Elementary School District #1 and devote a large part of my professional life as a teacher to helping my students find strength in their voice through accountable talk, but now it is my turn to take the stage.

Where will your money go?

Here's what I need:

  • A plane ticket, ahotel, and food.

  • I probably need around a grand to make this happen, but anything helps. Every dollar you donate will go directly to getting me to Charlotte to represent Phoenix.

  • I am hoping I can raise enough money to cover these basic.

Why should I donate?

  • Because you love me.

  • I am working at Circle K to pay my bills, and fund raising for something like this is extremely time-consuming.

  • The Phoenix Slam Team promises to bring the funny. Comedic poetry rarely gets the appreciation it deserves, and the Phoenix team will be bringing a majority of funny pieces that will make you laugh (or at least attempt to).

story:
Ah, yes. Another crowd-sourced funding campaign. I know, I know…

I hope you’ll hear me out.

I’ve recently been humbled by the opportunity to write the history of Newmarket (New Hampshire), a place I hold dear in my heart. A place I called home for over a decade. A place that graciously presented me with many of my life’s ups, and downs. Some of you know what I mean there. Some of you don’t. I’d be happy to tell you all about it sometime if you don’t know, and would like to learn more.

You’ve probably seen these town history books around. The publisher is Arcadia (www.arcadiapublishing.com). They specialize in town histories, and the volumes they release are fueled by historic images. Images (and personal sentiment) are what drove me to take on this project. When I first moved to Newmarket I saw a photo of a massive ship set in the Lamprey River behind the old mill buildings in town (where I lived for a number of years with my family – the first roof that my one year-old son Willy J. called home as well…). I couldn’t fathom that a ship that size could sit in that river – a river my dog Red swam across just about every day when the weather was warm. That’s part of the history though; the industry that fueled Newmarket for many, many years. Upon seeing that photo, I wanted to learn more, and was immediately drawn to the undertaking of formally writing the town’s history in a volume that will be accented by the very photos that drew me in to begin with.

So why am I firing up a crowd-sourced funding campaign?

I’m going to be honest with you. This project isn’t about money for me. It’s about serving a community that has been very good to me over the years. When the book is released I'll be working author events for the town to help them raise money for the Historical Society.

I’m using this campaign as a pre-sale of the book. Basically, I have the opportunity to order copies of the book before it’s published to sell for myself. That opportunity, along with a (small) royalty is the only monetary means of compensation for the project. And I’m fine with that. I don’t expect to make any money off of this deal. I’d love for you to support me and purchase a copy in advance. It would mean the world to me. But, I wouldn’t be offended if you wanted to wait it out, and purchase it for a nickel off of Amazon a couple years from now. I understand.

Basically, the number of copies I order are the number of copies people purchase during the tenure of this campaign. The cover price of the book is $22. I’m going to start selling them at $20.

The due-date for the book is August. I'm assuming it will be published in the Fall (in time for the holiday season). I'll give the specific pub date when I receive it from Arcadia. But rest-assured, this is real. The contract is signed. Those that know me, know that I'm a man of my word.

Please, if you can afford it, grab one for the bookshelf, or to use as a coaster to keep your beverage upright, and your table dry. I know history books aren’t the most exciting things in the world, but the photos are at least cool to look at! It’ll be a conversation piece… And again, it would mean the world to me if you helped me out and supported this project, even if that means simply sharing this campaign with your friends.

Thanks for the consideration!

Kind regards,

-Chris Hislop

story:
Who am I?

My name is Dragos Roua and, right now, I'm a digital nomad. For 10 years, I had an online publishing company, which I decided to sell in 2008. Since then. I focused on building myself, instead of building a business. Which proved to be "slightly" harder than building a business.

I traveled around the world, I experienced various lifestyles, from being raw vegan for 9 months, up to working continuously in coffee shops, and even creating and managing weekly events in them. I wrote 6 books, 2 of them being translated, printed and sold in Korea. I built a blog visited by hundreds of thousands of people each year. I wrote my own productivity framework and I also wrote an iOS app for it (without previous knowledge of Objective C whatsoever). I learned to tango. I started to run and I finished my first marathon. I "tamed monkeys".

Now, I want to put this experience into a book. Why? So others may learn from it. If so they choose, of course. Otherwise, they could simply enjoy the story.

It's the story of somebody who decided to live off the grid, but still to provide genuine value, while being constructively free.

What Do I Need And What Do You Get?

What's in it for you? Simply put, the book. Your money will help me sustain my activities and current lifestyle, to edit it and to publish it. You will be part of something new, and, most likely, exciting. The smallest perk will also give you the finished book, in printed form.

The amount will be split as follows:

- $6000 sustaining my activities for 2 months, while focusing entirely on the book

- $4000 editing and publishing expenses

If I don't reach my goal, I will still publish the book, tryng to get alternative funding.

For $15, you get the book, period. Printed and shipped to your house.

For $50, you get 3 copies of the book, printed and shipped to your address, no strings attached.

For $1000 you will be listed on the back cover of the book as an official baker of this project, for as long as the book will stay in print.

Why Should I Support This Project?

Because you secretely long to know what this "digital nomading" buzz is about. And there's no better way to learn this than from someone who's already doing it.
 
Because you will help create a book that will give a new perspective to the world. I don't claim it will be necessarily better than the one you have right now, but it will be challenging for sure.
 
Because you will do a good thing. You will feel better about yourself.

I Won't Donate, There's Something Else I Can Do?

Your attention, care and energy spent just by reading this will help. Seriously. I do believe in this kind of stuff.
 
But if you can make some noise about this project, spread the word around, let others, potentially interested people, that this thing is going on, I will be even more grateful. Also, just using indiegogo sharing tools will make a big difference.
 
Thank you!

Hi my name is Kersey, I love to serve and help others! I have always wanted to help children in need and now i finally have the chance to!

I want to help improve the Kids Alive Program and create happy memories for the Orphans and at-risk children in the Dominican Republic. 

The cost for the whole thing will be $1,900. I am trying my hardest to raise the money myself, but as you may know money is scares for college students. That is why I am asking for your help!

If I raise more money than i need than i will donate it to the Kids Alive Program. Don't worry... i won't take it for myself...

If you donate at least $25 dollars i would be more than happy to send you pictures and a summary of the trip! Remember to give me your e-mail so i can make that possible...

story:
Atlas Magazine is a student-run, student-funded organization at Emerson College. Each semester, we publish a lifestyle magazine that brings innovative, entertaining, and thought-provoking content to Emerson College. In our third semester, we aim to bring "The New Renaissance" to Emerson's campus and beyond-but first, we need your help. 

Our goal this semester is to print 500 issues. This growth would be beneficial to us as a campus institution--in Fall 2011, our issue existed in digital format only, and in Spring 2012 we were able to print 200 copies. If we can achieve our print goal, we will be able to reach more students on campus than ever before, and continue to spread the content that we believe in. 

 

How You Can Help: 

  • Donate! Whether you're able to contribute $5, $10, or $100 to our campaign, your support means the world to our staff. 
  • Share! Can't donate? That's fine, we still appreciate you. Instead, spread the word via social media. Tweet, Facebook, or reblog our campaign to help us spread the word.
  • Subscribe! Visit our website and learn more about our special subscription deals.

 

Connect: 

Website // Blog // Twitter // Facebook


Our Mission Statement:

Atlas magazine is a student-produced lifestyle publication that aims to strengthen its staff’s professional experience and remain accessible to all Emerson students. Through its Industry, Arts, Health, Style, Campus, City, and Globe sections, Atlas fosters interaction between all fields of study in its online blog and biannual issue. Atlas also hosts and supports community service and both on- and off-campus events.

We aim to be as accurate a representation of the Emerson Community as possible, so if you have any questions, concerns, suggestions or feedback contact us at emersonatlasmag@gmail.com.

We aim to be as accurate a representation of the Emerson Community as possible, so if you have any questions, concerns, suggestions or feedback contact us at emersonatlasmag@gmail.com.

story:
My name is Cynthia Chen. I am a professional musician who lives in New Orleans. About 7 years ago, I viewed a video on YouTube which told a story about the plight of endangered elephants which moved me very deeply. The way in which these magnificent creatures are massacred for their ivory is atrocious. Back in the days of Ceasar there were millions of elephants roaming the earth. Today there are less than 1 million left. The elephants have been killed for centuries for their ivory which is mostly in demand in the Far East. This project is partly to reveal the plight of endangered elephants as well as tell a story of love and intrigue.

I have had this idea to write a fictional book based on true facts about the Ivory Trade. I plan to travel to research and observe the corrupt underworld of this cruel trade and its involvement based on greed and vanity for trinkets and trophy objects made of ivory.

For the last 8 years I have been researching the plight of elephants..from elephants in captivity to their endangered plight in Africa and Asia.

The story will feature an Asian American female heroine whose heart is captured by an elephant and her observations of the elephant's herd and how they are threatened by poachers. The heroine travels to China and a story unravels about the plight of the elephant versus the Ivory Trade.

This will be a fictional piece based on true facts regarding the Ivory Trade. A percentage of the proceeds of this book will be donated to reputable elephant preservation charities.

Hopefully this book will enlighten people about the ivory trade and the increasing endangerment of elephants.

story:
The Tiny Tale

  • Hello! My name is Chel O'Reilly. I am a fan of people and words and I like mixing them up. I write letters to friends, and friends have even go so far as to publish those letters themselves (which was awfully nice of 'em). Some samples of my letters are on the Optimists Write Love Letters website.
  • This campaign is for the sake of writing and publishing a book - a book of letters. 
  • Your biggest contribution isn't just fiscal - it's inspirational. I can't write to the ether. I need to write to people. I want to write to you! The collection of letters to all of you IS the book.

Giveth and Receiveth

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • The funding raised in this campaign covers: the cost of writing the book, the perks and keeping the lights on while I do it. 
  • There are some cool perks, including: posters, books, t-shirts, tickets to the launch party, a song... but every contributor gets my favorite part - a letter. You're not just part of the campaign, you will be part of the book itself.
  • This campaign is set up with a fixed goal - it's all or nothing my friends. That's my challenge, my dare. The goal is for the campaign to be finished by the end of January 2013 and the book to be finished & printed by December 31st, 2013.

 

What Happens When...

The project will result in US mail, email, a blog and a book. Whew!

The perks will include letters, posters, t-shirts, books... and if you're the one crazy amazing top tier donor, I have lots in store for you!  

  • Here's The Optimists Write Love Letters Project in a few simple steps:
    • I write you a letter. Don't worry, later, I'll email you a copy in case my handwriting isn't awesome. 
    • I'll do a quick edit to a level of comfortable anonymity so your letter (sans name) can be shared on the Optimists Write Love Letters blog, and later, the book.
    • When your letter goes online, since I won't be publishing your name, I will create a hyperlink to your favorite charity. Why? Do we really need a reason to be nice?
  • The "drop date" for when this whole thing begins is the day after the funding goal is reached - sometime in the next month. It will take several months to pen letters to so many people, so your patience is appreciated. I'll be writing consecutively of when each supporter signs up. Obviously, the book can't be published until the letters are done, so the best delivery date of that will be a few months down the line.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are SO many ways you can help. You could, for instance, be a big mouth!

Please make some noise on Twitter, FB, Tumblr, follow me, share me, see what's the latest news...

Oh, and there are share tools, right here on Indiegogo! Technology is here for the laz-- I mean SMART. Technology is for those smart enough to take the lazy way...
